summary: On this episode of What’s New to Netflix Instant!? there are plenty of high-speed thrills, mystery, intrigue, passion, and...
caption:
On this episode of What’s New to Netflix Instant!? there are plenty of high-speed thrills, mystery, intrigue, passion, and doppelgängers but not before we run down the all new June Netflix Instant Watch releases for 2019.

Afterwards we join Chris Evans as he leads an uprising planning to overthrow a super train that harbors the last remaining humans on the planet in Snowpiercer from 2013. Next, Angelina Jolie tries to capture a serial killer that takes on the identities of the victims he kills while also having a relationship with someone who might have ulterior motives in Taking Lives from 2004. And finally, Mark Duplass and Elizabeth Moss are an unhappy couple that decide to go to a cabin for the weekend but what they encounter isn’t exactly what they expected in the surreal dramedy, The One I Love from 2014.

All of this plus documentaries about documentaries, movies that you might need to watch more than 5 times to appreciate, tiny soldiers, Jon Favreau loves cooking, and has everyone already seen Neon Genesis Evangelion or did Netflix do something people are actually looking forward to?

download here: http://www.mediafire.com/file/eptcqepc3obwj3n/WNTNI_episode+56.mp3

got a suggestion for the show?: whatsnewtonetflixinstant@gmail.com

title: Chris Imagine - 12/13 - lista nova
body:
12- você esqueceu

13- As vezes parece que você não me ama mais.

Imagine referente a segunda lista de diálogos que eu postei no Wattpad.

_____________________________________

S/n já estava ficando frustada e sem paciência esperando o namorado chegar, ela sabia que os horários de Chris eram imprevisíveis por ele ser ator, mas o rapaz sempre avisa quando iria demorar e ele nunca tinha demorado tanto assim. Quando S/n finalmente perdeu toda a paciência resolveu ir para casa, depois de ter ficado três horas esperando. O que a deixou mais irritada dói chegar em casa e encontrar o namorado assistindo tv. S/n não falou nada apenas foi para o quarto trocar de roupa, e Chris como percebeu a presença da namorada foi atrás.

- Onde você foi que esta toda arrumando? - Chris perguntou - Você não falou que sairia com suas amigas hoje.

S/n não respondeu nada apenas encarou seria o namorado, Chris percebeu isso e achou melhor deixar a garota sozinha, já que obviamente ela estava irritada com algo.

Quando os dois já estavam deitados, Chris tentou falar outra vez com a namorada.

- Aconteceu algo? Você chegou irritada hoje, nem falou comigo.

- Você esqueceu? - S/n perguntou seria .

- Esqueci o que? Tinha algo de importante hoje ? - Chris perguntou confuso.

- Chris que dia é hoje?

- Quarta feira dia 26 de junho.

- Exato, e o que acontece no dia 26 de junho.

- Nada … Droga é nosso aniversário de casamento.

- Sim, e você me deixou 3 horas plantada no restaurante em que você fez a reserva.

- Eu sinto muito, eu esqueci.

- Sério não me diga, eu nem tinha percebido que você tinha esquecido. - Falou levantando da cama.

- Onde você vai? esta tarde.

- Eu vou dormir no quarto de hóspedes.

- S/n volta aqui, vamos conversar.

- Não tem mais o que conversar Chris, eu estou cansada.

- Tudo bem, vai dormir nós podemos  conversar sobre isso de manhã.

- Não Chris, você entendeu. Eu estou casada de tudo isso. Sabe não foi a primeira vez quem que você me deixou esperando no restaurante e não pareceu. Foi a terceira vez. Sabe as vezes eu sinto que você não me ama mais.

- Você sabe que não é verdade, eu te amo.

- Então prove.

- Certo, nós podemos ir jantar fora amanhã.

- Isso não vai resolver nada. Não é só sobre o jantar Chris, são as pequenas coisas que você esqueceu. Chris eu vou passar uns tempos com a minha minha mãe, vai ser melhor assim.

- Você não pode desistir de nós, não agora.

- Chris, não fui eu quem desistiu e sim você, uns dois meses atrás.

title: What Happens Now
body:
Chris Evans x Reader

A/N: Another request down, yay! Anon I hop you like it, wherever you may be if you’re still out there. Sorry it took so long.

Request: Hi, can you please write a Chris Evans imagine when the condom breaks, and the reader ends up pregnant. And they get into a argument about it because she’s not ready yet(because she’s younger than him), but he is because he isn’t getting any younger. And they end up keeping the baby. Thank you 💖💕❤️💜

Warnings: Kinda angsty, pregnancy

“Did it break?”

“I-I’m not sure.”

“How can you not be sure!?”

“I’m checking, I’m checking… Jesus hold on!”

You sat back as you watched Chris. He looked down checking and then looked back up at you with a shocked look on his face. It only took you a second to register what that look meant. You collapsed back on the bed, your hand on your forehead.

“No, no, no!”

“Okay, okay, Y/N relax…”

“Relax! Chris how can I relax? This is serious!”

“Y/N, babe, it probably means nothing, just one slip up.”

You sat up and stared at him hard. He was acting so nonchalant but you knew that this could be something serious and it was starting to annoy you.

“Chris,” you finally said. “The condom broke. All it takes is one slip up you know that. This isn’t something to act as if it’s no big deal.”

He sighed then scooted up to sit against the headboard next to you.

“Okay, so what happens now? What do we do?”

“Well, I guess I have to take a test, but I can’t now because it’s too early.” You put your head in your hands. “So, we wait.”

Chris was silent for a moment, thinking.

“What- what if you are, that could be a good thing, right?”

You lifted your head to look at him. A good thing?

“Chris, what are you saying?”

“I’m saying, that it wouldn’t be such a bad thing if you’re pregnant.”

“I think it would!”

“Why?” He asked, genuinely confused.

You shook your head, not wanting to confess your fears right then. “Let’s just wait for the test, all right?”

You swung your feet off the bed and walked into the bathroom, closing the door behind you and turning on the shower. You didn’t get in right away, but sat on the edge of the tub to think. 

If I am, what am I gonna do? I’m not ready for this. I have too much I want to do first. You shook your head again. Now was not the time to get worried. You haven’t even taken the test yet, there was a chance you couldn’t be. You had to hold on to that hope. You heaved yourself off the toilet and stepped into the shower, trying to not worry anymore.

———–

You had waited three weeks. Yeah, you had missed your period, but then again it could be late. You were stressed out after all and you knew that affected it. 

You paced up and down the bedroom, looking at your phone every few seconds to see if you had waited enough time. You sighed and went into the bathroom, where you left the test sitting on the counter - you hadn’t been able to be in the same room as it - and looked down at the little stick on the counter. 

There it was, as clear as day, “pregnant” it read.  You picked it up and shook it, half out of frustration and anger, half as if it would change the result, but there the word was still in the little window, staring at you.You threw it down and sat on the side of the tub in shock. 

That’s where Chris found you an hour later.

“Babe, where are you?” you heard his voice call from the living room. You didn’t respond. “Babe?” His voice came closer, he was in the bedroom now.

You didn’t look up when he popped his head in the bathroom. “There you are! What are you doing in here?”

You just shook your head, unable to speak. 

“What’s wrong?” He asked looking concerned.

You opened your mouth to answer, but no words came out. Your mouth felt dry. You cleared your throat and tried again.

“It- it’s positive.” The words came out in a whisper.

“Positive? What’s positive?” He looked around and spotted the test on the ground next to your foot.

You watched his face as understanding dawned upon it, followed by a big smile. You  glared at him but he didn’t notice.

“Oh my god, this is fantastic! I’m gonna be a dad! Oh man, I gotta call mom!” He rummaged in his pocket for his phone.

“Chris, Chris stop,” you said as you grabbed his hand, stopping him from dialing. “I think we need to talk.”

“Talk about what?”

You took a deep breath to calm yourself. “I- I don’t know if I want to have this baby right now.”

“What do you mean?”

“What I mean is, I don’t want to be a mom right now…”

“Why not? So, what are you gonna do? You’re not talkin about getting rid of it?”

You looked into his eyes that were full of distress and shook your head. You stood up and walked into the bedroom and began pacing again for a minute before speaking.

“I’m not saying that… exactly. I’m just not ready for this. I feel like I’m too young and…”

But he cut you off. “And I’m not getting any younger here, Y/N! This is a good thing, don’t you see that?”

“A good thing for who? For you? I’m not ready to go through all that. I’m not ready to be a mother. I have too much I still want to do. What about my job, what about traveling?”

“You can still do that!” He argued. “You can still do all of that!”

“How!?” You practically shouted, then quieter you asked, “How can I do all that with a baby on my hip and taking up all my time and money?”

“You act as if you’re gonna be alone. I’ll be helping you.”

You snorted. “Chris, you’re gone half the year filming and doing press tours, how often will you be here to ‘help’ me?”

“I-I’ll just cut back on some of that.”

“Sure you will,” you said with a roll of your eyes.

“I will!” He insisted as you shook your head.

“Chris,” you said pleadingly, wanting to make him understand. “I cannot do this right now. This, this is one of my biggest fears and now that it’s happened, I can’t see a way to get over it.”

“Y/N, this isn’t something to be afraid of.”

“How can you say that? You don’t understand! To me, this is a bigger interruption of my life than it is for you. And…” you paused not wanting to voice your biggest fear of them all.

“And what, Y/N?” He grabbed your hands, but you wouldn’t look at him, keeping your eyes focused on the wall behind him. “Tell me.”

“And… what if one day… you decide you-you’ve had enough,” you stammered out, still not meeting his eyes. “What if one day you decide to just leave?”

He was quiet for a long while before speaking,“How- how could you say that?”  The heartbreak in his voice nearly brought you to tears. “I would never do that! I would never abandon you or our child!”

“You say that now,” you said, your voice thick with unshed tears, shaking your hands from him grip. “But who’s to say what will happen? If it takes too much of your time or your energy, what’s keeping you around?”

“Love!” He insisted vehemently. “Love is what’s gonna keep me around. Love for you and love for our child.”

You kept shaking your head, the tears finally falling. “I can’t Chris, I can’t do this.” And before he could stop you, you stormed out of the room.

Chris was hot on your heels however. You had grabbed your purse and keys and had your hand on the door knob ready to leave, where you had no idea. He grabbed your arm, stopping you before you walked out.

“Y/N, please, let’s talk about this.”

“We already have, Chris. I just… I need to leave for a while.” You loosened his grip on your arm and opened the door. “I’m sorry.”

You got in your car and started it, looking back at your house, you saw Chris standing there with a sad look on his face, you didn’t see the tears though. You turned a way and backed out of the driveway and drove off.

————-

“Yeah, yeah mom I know I can’t force her,” Chris was saying into his phone hours later. You still hadn’t turned up and he had called his mom to ask for advice. When he had told her that you were pregnant, she had been excited. Then he told her about the conversation between you two, and she settled down to help her son through his feelings.

“Give her some time, you have to realize what a shock this is for her,” she told him.

He sighed into the phone. “I know, I know,” he paused.

“What is it? What else happened?” 

Chris couldn’t help but let out a soft chuckle, even over the phone, she knew something was wrong with him.

“Well,” he began. “She said she was worried that one day I’d get tired of all of it and just up and leave. I think it’s her biggest fear, being left alone to take care of a baby by herself.”

“I can see that,” she said softly, then more sternly, “you wouldn’t do that though. I raised you far better than that!”

“You did!” He told her defensively. “I would never do that! You know how long I’ve wanted to be a dad!”

“Okay, I know, I just had to say that.”

“I know. I know. I just don’t know what to do.”

“I can’t tell you what to do and I can’t tell you what will happen, just give her time. That’s all.”

“Okay, mom.”

“It’ll all be okay, whatever happens, it’ll be okay.”

They talked for a little while longer before hanging up. Unsure of what to do, Chris began pacing around the house, trying to find something to occupy himself with. He tried watching tv and reading and cleaning, nothing helped. He finally decided to go find you. He wouldn’t pressure you, like his mother had cautioned against, but he wanted to prove to you that he’d be there for you. He collected his key and headed out to his car; thinking hard about where you might have gone.

Meanwhile you had drove around for a while, no particular destination in mind. When you finally became tired of just driving around aimlessly, you drove over to the park only a few miles from your house. Getting out, you walked along one of the paths until you found a bench to sit on. You sat back and watched the people enjoying their weekend. It amazed you that there were people who were going on with their lives without this problem looming over them.

You were lost in thought when you heard a shout. You shook yourself out of it just in time to see a bright blue and green ball bouncing towards you with a little girl toddling after it, her pigtails bouncing. You caught it easily.

“My ball!” The girl said to you.

Her mom ran up behind her. “Mia, that’s not nice. Ask the lady for it back.”

Mia looked up at you, her bright eyes shining in the sun. “May I pwease have my ball back?”

“Yes, of course, sweetheart,” you said handing it back to her.

“Tank you!” she said with a smile, then she asked you, “Toss ball?”

“Uh, yeah sure,” you said looking at her mother to see if it was okay. She nodded with a smile and you stood up. 

Little Mia tossed the ball with all her might, sending it flying about two feet. You laughed and rolled it back to her, but she missed and toddled off after it. Next, she tossed it to her mom. You three played this game for a while, you talking to her mom while you both watched the little girl chase after the ball, until Mia stopped and pointed.

“Who that?”

You and her mom looked around to where she was pointing and there stood Chris. He was watching you with a small smile on his lips.

“That’s my friend,” you told the little girl and her mom, “I’ll be right back.”

You walked toward Chris.

“So you found me,” you said to him.

“Yeah, so I did. Look Y/N, I don’t wanna pressure you into anything…”

“I know, I know. I’m just in shock about all this.”

He nodded. “I get that, maybe we could talk…” he stopped and smiled again.

“What?”

He nodded behind you and you turned and saw little Mia standing behind you, clutching her ball against her.

“Miss Y/N, come back and play.”

You smiled and bent down to talk to her. “Okay, but only if my friend plays too.”

Mia looked Chris up and down, considering him for a minute, then nodded. She then stepped back and threw the ball to him. He laughed and caught it.

“Oh, that was a good one! You could play for the Patriots with an arm like that.”

Mia giggled at his praise and watched as he tossed the ball to you, you caught it, then rolled it to Mia. 

Your game went on for another twenty minutes or so, before her mom called to her that it was time to leave.

“It was so nice meeting you both,” you said shaking her mom’s hand while Mia hugged Chris. 

“It was nice meeting you too,” she said. “Come on Mia, let’s go, honey.”

Before she walked off she ran and hugged you tight. You lifted her up and looked in her eyes. You both smiled at each other, and you felt yourself relax for the first time in weeks. Mia then reached her arms around your neck and hugged you again.

“Bye, bye Miss Y/N.”

You hugged her back. “Bye, bye Mia.”

You put her down and she ran over to her mom. You watched them walk away, your hand resting on your stomach. You then turned to Chris.

“Let’s go talk,” you said softly.

He nodded and took your hand and steered you onto a path. You two walked hand in hand in deep conversation around the park three times until it had gotten dark.

—————

You exhaled and stretched your back, trying to alleviate some of the discomfort you felt. You readjusted the gown you had on, then swung your legs. You felt Chris reach out and stop one of them.

“You’re fidgeting, sweetheart.”

“Well, I’m nervous.” 

“Why? You’ve been here about five times already, you’d think you’d be used to this by now.” 

Your reply was cut off by the door opening. In walked your doctor, a cheery middle aged lady with short cropped hair.

“All right now, Miss Y/N, how are we doing this month?”

“I’m okay.”

Chris cleared his throat loudly causing you to glare at him.

“Okay well I’ve been having really bad heartburn,” you confessed. 

Your doctor nodded. “Yes, that will happen. I’ll give you some stuff for that.”

She laid you back and covered your bottom half with a sheet, then lifting the gown up over the mound that was now your belly, she squeezed some gel onto it. Then moved the device around. Soon, on the screen, you and Chris both saw the outline of your baby. You had seen it before, but the tears still came to your eyes. Yes you were still nervous, but true to his word, Chris was right there. You felt him grab your hand and kiss it. You squeezed his back.

“Hey there,” you said to the screen softly. “I can’t wait to meet you.”

“Chris,” you finally said. “The condom broke. All it takes is one slip up you know that. This isn’t something to act as if it’s no big deal.”

“Okay, so what happens now? What do we do?”

“Well, I guess I have to take a test, but I can’t now because it’s too early.” You put your head in your hands. “So, we wait.”

Chris was silent for a moment, thinking.

“What- what if you are, that could be a good thing, right?”

You lifted your head to look at him. A good thing?

“Chris, what are you saying?”

“I’m saying, that it wouldn’t be such a bad thing if you’re pregnant.”

“I think it would!”

“Why?” He asked, genuinely confused.

You shook your head, not wanting to confess your fears right then. “Let’s just wait for the test, all right?”

You swung your feet off the bed and walked into the bathroom, closing the door behind you and turning on the shower. You didn’t get in right away, but sat on the edge of the tub to think. 

If I am, what am I gonna do? I’m not ready for this. I have too much I want to do first. You shook your head again. Now was not the time to get worried. You haven’t even taken the test yet, there was a chance you couldn’t be. You had to hold on to that hope. You heaved yourself off the toilet and stepped into the shower, trying to not worry anymore.

———–

You had waited three weeks. Yeah, you had missed your period, but then again it could be late. You were stressed out after all and you knew that affected it. 

You paced up and down the bedroom, looking at your phone every few seconds to see if you had waited enough time. You sighed and went into the bathroom, where you left the test sitting on the counter - you hadn’t been able to be in the same room as it - and looked down at the little stick on the counter. 

There it was, as clear as day, “pregnant” it read.  You picked it up and shook it, half out of frustration and anger, half as if it would change the result, but there the word was still in the little window, staring at you.You threw it down and sat on the side of the tub in shock. 

That’s where Chris found you an hour later.

“Babe, where are you?” you heard his voice call from the living room. You didn’t respond. “Babe?” His voice came closer, he was in the bedroom now.

You didn’t look up when he popped his head in the bathroom. “There you are! What are you doing in here?”

You just shook your head, unable to speak. 

“What’s wrong?” He asked looking concerned.

You opened your mouth to answer, but no words came out. Your mouth felt dry. You cleared your throat and tried again.

“It- it’s positive.” The words came out in a whisper.

“Positive? What’s positive?” He looked around and spotted the test on the ground next to your foot.

You watched his face as understanding dawned upon it, followed by a big smile. You  glared at him but he didn’t notice.

“Oh my god, this is fantastic! I’m gonna be a dad! Oh man, I gotta call mom!” He rummaged in his pocket for his phone.

“Chris, Chris stop,” you said as you grabbed his hand, stopping him from dialing. “I think we need to talk.”

“Talk about what?”

You took a deep breath to calm yourself. “I- I don’t know if I want to have this baby right now.”

“What do you mean?”

“What I mean is, I don’t want to be a mom right now…”

“Why not? So, what are you gonna do? You’re not talkin about getting rid of it?”

You looked into his eyes that were full of distress and shook your head. You stood up and walked into the bedroom and began pacing again for a minute before speaking.

“I’m not saying that… exactly. I’m just not ready for this. I feel like I’m too young and…”

But he cut you off. “And I’m not getting any younger here, Y/N! This is a good thing, don’t you see that?”

“A good thing for who? For you? I’m not ready to go through all that. I’m not ready to be a mother. I have too much I still want to do. What about my job, what about traveling?”

“You can still do that!” He argued. “You can still do all of that!”

“How!?” You practically shouted, then quieter you asked, “How can I do all that with a baby on my hip and taking up all my time and money?”

“You act as if you’re gonna be alone. I’ll be helping you.”

You snorted. “Chris, you’re gone half the year filming and doing press tours, how often will you be here to ‘help’ me?”

“I-I’ll just cut back on some of that.”

“Sure you will,” you said with a roll of your eyes.

“I will!” He insisted as you shook your head.

“Chris,” you said pleadingly, wanting to make him understand. “I cannot do this right now. This, this is one of my biggest fears and now that it’s happened, I can’t see a way to get over it.”

“Y/N, this isn’t something to be afraid of.”

“How can you say that? You don’t understand! To me, this is a bigger interruption of my life than it is for you. And…” you paused not wanting to voice your biggest fear of them all.

“And what, Y/N?” He grabbed your hands, but you wouldn’t look at him, keeping your eyes focused on the wall behind him. “Tell me.”

“And… what if one day… you decide you-you’ve had enough,” you stammered out, still not meeting his eyes. “What if one day you decide to just leave?”

He was quiet for a long while before speaking,“How- how could you say that?”  The heartbreak in his voice nearly brought you to tears. “I would never do that! I would never abandon you or our child!”

“You say that now,” you said, your voice thick with unshed tears, shaking your hands from him grip. “But who’s to say what will happen? If it takes too much of your time or your energy, what’s keeping you around?”

“Love!” He insisted vehemently. “Love is what’s gonna keep me around. Love for you and love for our child.”

You kept shaking your head, the tears finally falling. “I can’t Chris, I can’t do this.” And before he could stop you, you stormed out of the room.

Chris was hot on your heels however. You had grabbed your purse and keys and had your hand on the door knob ready to leave, where you had no idea. He grabbed your arm, stopping you before you walked out.

“Y/N, please, let’s talk about this.”

“We already have, Chris. I just… I need to leave for a while.” You loosened his grip on your arm and opened the door. “I’m sorry.”

You got in your car and started it, looking back at your house, you saw Chris standing there with a sad look on his face, you didn’t see the tears though. You turned a way and backed out of the driveway and drove off.

“And what, Y/N?” He grabbed your hands, but you wouldn’t look at him, keeping your eyes focused on the wall behind him. “Tell me.”

“And… what if one day… you decide you-you’ve had enough,” you stammered out, still not meeting his eyes. “What if one day you decide to just leave?”

He was quiet for a long while before speaking,“How- how could you say that?”  The heartbreak in his voice nearly brought you to tears. “I would never do that! I would never abandon you or our child!”

“You say that now,” you said, your voice thick with unshed tears, shaking your hands from him grip. “But who’s to say what will happen? If it takes too much of your time or your energy, what’s keeping you around?”

“Love!” He insisted vehemently. “Love is what’s gonna keep me around. Love for you and love for our child.”

You kept shaking your head, the tears finally falling. “I can’t Chris, I can’t do this.” And before he could stop you, you stormed out of the room.

Chris was hot on your heels however. You had grabbed your purse and keys and had your hand on the door knob ready to leave, where you had no idea. He grabbed your arm, stopping you before you walked out.

“Y/N, please, let’s talk about this.”

“We already have, Chris. I just… I need to leave for a while.” You loosened his grip on your arm and opened the door. “I’m sorry.”

You got in your car and started it, looking back at your house, you saw Chris standing there with a sad look on his face, you didn’t see the tears though. You turned a way and backed out of the driveway and drove off.

————-

“Yeah, yeah mom I know I can’t force her,” Chris was saying into his phone hours later. You still hadn’t turned up and he had called his mom to ask for advice. When he had told her that you were pregnant, she had been excited. Then he told her about the conversation between you two, and she settled down to help her son through his feelings.

“Give her some time, you have to realize what a shock this is for her,” she told him.

He sighed into the phone. “I know, I know,” he paused.

“What is it? What else happened?” 

Chris couldn’t help but let out a soft chuckle, even over the phone, she knew something was wrong with him.

“Well,” he began. “She said she was worried that one day I’d get tired of all of it and just up and leave. I think it’s her biggest fear, being left alone to take care of a baby by herself.”

“I can see that,” she said softly, then more sternly, “you wouldn’t do that though. I raised you far better than that!”

“You did!” He told her defensively. “I would never do that! You know how long I’ve wanted to be a dad!”

“Okay, I know, I just had to say that.”

“I know. I know. I just don’t know what to do.”

“I can’t tell you what to do and I can’t tell you what will happen, just give her time. That’s all.”

“Okay, mom.”

“It’ll all be okay, whatever happens, it’ll be okay.”

They talked for a little while longer before hanging up. Unsure of what to do, Chris began pacing around the house, trying to find something to occupy himself with. He tried watching tv and reading and cleaning, nothing helped. He finally decided to go find you. He wouldn’t pressure you, like his mother had cautioned against, but he wanted to prove to you that he’d be there for you. He collected his key and headed out to his car; thinking hard about where you might have gone.

Meanwhile you had drove around for a while, no particular destination in mind. When you finally became tired of just driving around aimlessly, you drove over to the park only a few miles from your house. Getting out, you walked along one of the paths until you found a bench to sit on. You sat back and watched the people enjoying their weekend. It amazed you that there were people who were going on with their lives without this problem looming over them.

You were lost in thought when you heard a shout. You shook yourself out of it just in time to see a bright blue and green ball bouncing towards you with a little girl toddling after it, her pigtails bouncing. You caught it easily.

“My ball!” The girl said to you.

Her mom ran up behind her. “Mia, that’s not nice. Ask the lady for it back.”

Mia looked up at you, her bright eyes shining in the sun. “May I pwease have my ball back?”

“Yes, of course, sweetheart,” you said handing it back to her.

“Tank you!” she said with a smile, then she asked you, “Toss ball?”

“Uh, yeah sure,” you said looking at her mother to see if it was okay. She nodded with a smile and you stood up. 

Little Mia tossed the ball with all her might, sending it flying about two feet. You laughed and rolled it back to her, but she missed and toddled off after it. Next, she tossed it to her mom. You three played this game for a while, you talking to her mom while you both watched the little girl chase after the ball, until Mia stopped and pointed.

“Who that?”

You and her mom looked around to where she was pointing and there stood Chris. He was watching you with a small smile on his lips.

“That’s my friend,” you told the little girl and her mom, “I’ll be right back.”

You walked toward Chris.

“So you found me,” you said to him.

“Yeah, so I did. Look Y/N, I don’t wanna pressure you into anything…”

“I know, I know. I’m just in shock about all this.”

He nodded. “I get that, maybe we could talk…” he stopped and smiled again.

“What?”

He nodded behind you and you turned and saw little Mia standing behind you, clutching her ball against her.

“Miss Y/N, come back and play.”

You smiled and bent down to talk to her. “Okay, but only if my friend plays too.”

Mia looked Chris up and down, considering him for a minute, then nodded. She then stepped back and threw the ball to him. He laughed and caught it.

“Oh, that was a good one! You could play for the Patriots with an arm like that.”

Mia giggled at his praise and watched as he tossed the ball to you, you caught it, then rolled it to Mia. 

Your game went on for another twenty minutes or so, before her mom called to her that it was time to leave.

“It was nice meeting you too,” she said. “Come on Mia, let’s go, honey.”

He nodded and took your hand and steered you onto a path. You two walked hand in hand in deep conversation around the park three times until it had gotten dark.

—————

You exhaled and stretched your back, trying to alleviate some of the discomfort you felt. You readjusted the gown you had on, then swung your legs. You felt Chris reach out and stop one of them.

“Well, I’m nervous.” 

“Why? You’ve been here about five times already, you’d think you’d be used to this by now.”

“All right now, Miss Y/N, how are we doing this month?”

“I’m okay.”

Chris cleared his throat loudly causing you to glare at him.

“Okay well I’ve been having really bad heartburn,” you confessed. 

Your doctor nodded. “Yes, that will happen. I’ll give you some stuff for that.”

She laid you back and covered your bottom half with a sheet, then lifting the gown up over the mound that was now your belly, she squeezed some gel onto it. Then moved the device around. Soon, on the screen, you and Chris both saw the outline of your baby. You had seen it before, but the tears still came to your eyes. Yes you were still nervous, but true to his word, Chris was right there. You felt him grab your hand and kiss it. You squeezed his back.

“Hey there,” you said to the screen softly. “I can’t wait to meet you.”

question: i just tried to send a question in but i'm not sure if it went through, but i have a chris trivia question! in his autocomplete interview with mckenna, she said he's a vegetarian, which isn't the first time i've heard that - he didn't technically say he was a vegetarian, but what do you think?
answer:
I actually have no idea if he is or isn’t 🤔 I read somewhere ( that I cannot find the source of) that he does it for dieting and it was not a long term thing but that was a while ago. But this is also interesting considering I know what goes in to making all that lean muscle and I would imagine it can be hard as a vegetarian. But I have also heard him talk about eggs and chicken and you can’t eat that if you’re vegetarian soooo I’d say he probably has been in the past but isn’t on the day to day.

@ Chris Evans – tell us what’s up! Lol!

title: Prime Time - Part 4
body:
“’Cause baby it’s a prime time for our love, Ain’t nobody peekin’ but the stars above, It’s a prime time for our love, And heaven is betting on us”

Part 1, Part 2 , Part 3

You seemed to be floating through your days, you moved through the motions without ever really feeling like you were present, you felt as if your heart was elsewhere and you’re absentmindness hadn’t gone unnoticed and on Thursday your boss called you into her office. 

“Sit down, love,” she said with a warm smile. You took a seat across the desk from her, sitting a little awkwardly on the large chair. 

“How are you feeling?” she asked, she watched you closely, her eyes not leaving your face. 

“I’m fine,” you replied easily, it’s what you’d been telling everyone for the last three days, and it wasn’t a lie, you were absolutely fine but also, nothing was fine at all, your manager nodded and smiled sympathetically. 

“Is there anything at home bothering you?” she asked, you knew she was genuinely concerned for you but you found the exchange a little tedious. 

“No, nothing,” you replied, you could tell she wasn’t convinced so you added, “honestly Marie, everything’s fine I’ve just been headachy the last few days,” it was easier to lie about physical ailments that to be honest with her. 

“Okay love,” she said, “you know if anything is troubling you, anything at all, you can tell me right?" 

You nodded and smiled, you couldn’t ask for a more caring manager,but there were some things you couldn’t share, not right now anyway. 

"I know,” you replied with a smile, “and I would come to you,” you added. 

“Okay love,” she repeated, “anything you need,” we reaffirmed before giving you a slight nod that signaled that you were allowed to go back to your desk. 

You floated through the afternoons work and watched the clock relentlessly, watching the minutes tick by until home time. 

Once your work was done for the day you dashed down the office stairs and out into the balmy spring air, it was getting hot and the days were getting longer. The sun still shone brightly and reflected off the glass windows of the building around you. The sun’s warm rays felt like a blessing on your skin as you walked the mile from your office to your home. 

Alone in the cool of your apartment you noticed the answering machine light flashing on the home phone. You frowned, hardly anyone ever called the house phone, if they wanted to talk to you they called your mobile or texted you. Puzzled, you pressed the play button:

Hey sweetheart, your mobile was switched off but I just wanted you to know, I’ll be home early tomorrow morning and I’m taking you out for dinner tomorrow evening okay? Pick you up at 7.30. I thought it would be nice to getting dinner without Dodger trying to steal our food. See you tomorrow,“

Chris’s message sent a shiver from your belly out along your arms and legs to the tips of your toes and fingers. Just knowing he would be back tomorrow made you feel giddy with excitement but it also meant you faced another day just going through the motions and feeling out of place. 

You picked your mobile phone out of your bag and switched it on, you had switched it off when you went into a meeting early that day and it had slipped your mind to turn it back on. There were two missed calls from Chris and a picture of Dodger that he’d sent. 

Friday flashed past, like time had been switched from ultra slow to fast forward, you stood in front of your wardrobe, pushing the clothes around looking for something to wear that evening. 

You finally selected a deep blue knee length dress with a sweetheart neckline, you knew the cut flattered your body and the way it hung on you and made you feel good. The doorbell rang at 7.30 exactly, you pulled open the door, your heart was fluttering and you couldn’t help but grin at Chris standing there. 

He had on a pair of black trousers and a pale blue long sleeve shirt, over his arm he held a soft cream coloured knitted jumper. 

"Hey,” you greeted, a flush traveling up your neck. 

“Hey, you look lovely,” he said, kissing your cheek gently. 

“Looking pretty good yourself,” you replied, stepping aside and allowing him in your apartment, “I’m just going to get my shoes,” you said disappearing into your bedroom to find your shoes and slipping them on your feet. 

“Ready?” you asked, stepping back into the living room.

He nodded and stood, he pulled open the front door and allowed you to step through first, he followed you, stepping aside and allowing you to lock the door. 

He offered you is arm and the two of you walked down the stairs of your apartment block.

“So where are we going?” you asked as the two of you walked toward his car.

“That Italian place that does doesn’t really good baked pastas,” he replied, his voice sounding a little unsure. 

“Perfect, I love that place,” you replied, he pulled open the car door for you and you got in. 

He walked around the front of the vehicle and joined you. He looked over at you and smiled, he placed his hand gently on your bare thigh.

“You do really look lovely tonight,” he said. You knew he was being his absolute gentlemanly best, and he was also so charming. 

“Good enough to eat?” you teased. 

“And then some,” he replied, he turned the key in the ignition and pulled away from the curb. 

Over dinner you shared a bottle of wine and he told you all about his trip to LA, there was some sort of project in the works that he couldn’t tell you much about but he was clearly excited by it. 

As the evening wore on the atmosphere between the two of you seemed to change, it had started off as jokey and flirty, the way things normally were between the two of you, but after your deserts were cleared away, the tone changed, there was a look on his face that you’d not seen before and a tone in his voice that seemed to go straight between your thighs. 

He picked up the cheque and wouldn’t hear a word about you paying for your half of the bill. 

“My treat,” he had said firmly as you had gone to get your purse from your bag.

You had made a sound of protest but he had paid before you had the chance to reply, you had looked at him crossly, he reached across the table and took hold of your hand. 

“Look you,” he had said firmly, “if what we’re planning goes well I’m going to spend the rest of my life owing you for something I can never hope to repay so let me pay for dinner, okay?” his voice had been low and the look in his eyes told you that there would be nothing you could say to change his mind. 

“I’m sorry,” you replied, looking away from his face. 

“You don’t ever have to apologise to me, not for anything,” he said, you looked back and caught his eye, the look in them made your belly quiver. 

“Shall we go? Back to mine?” he added, stroking his fingers over your hand.

“I think so,” you replied, slipping your hand from his grip and standing. You collected your bag and swung the strap over your shoulder. 

Walking out of the restaurant side by side you felt Chris’s hand gently close around hand, his fingers laced through yours, he’s never held your hand like this before and it made your heart flutter. 

The drive back to Chris’s house was quiet and the air between the two of you seemed to crackle with excitement and anticipation. As he pulled out of the parking space Chris brought his hand to rest on your bare thigh, his hand was warm and dry but it sent a cold shiver through your whole body. 

At Chris’s house you were greeted by a very excited Dodger who bounced around the two of you, dashing between you and sniffing excitedly. 

“Come on Bubba,” Chris said quietly to Dodger, “Bed time for you,” he said leading Dodger into toward the utility room where his bed was set up. 

“Do you want a glass of wine?” Chris called from the kitchen while you took off your shoes by the door. 

“Yes please,” you called back, making your way down the hall toward the living room, you heard his footsteps on the floor behind you and turned to smile at him. 

Chris handed you a large glass of red wine with a shy smile.  “What do you wanna-” he started, a mischievous look on his face, “Shall we watch something… Or?” he added, cocking his head to the side.

“I would rather we, just, um,” you replied, your voice disappearing into nothing. Chris grinned at you and his cheeks flushed a pretty pink colour which made you smile. 

“After you sweetheart,” he said, motioning down the hall toward the half open door of his bedroom, you made your way toward the door, pushing it open and flicking on the light switch, Chris followed behind you, pushing the door half closed behind himself. 

You stood in the centre of the room, looking around, it wasn’t the first time you’d been in his room, not by a long way, but before you’d been using his en-suite or sleeping off a hangover. You turned to face him and found Chris watching you closely, he took a sip of his wine and set it down on the table close to the door. 

He took two steps toward you, closing the gap between your bodies, “Can I take that for you?” he said, gently taking the glass of wine from your hand. 

“I’ve not had a drink of it yet,” you said, trying to look cross as Chris placed it on the table beside his own. 

“I never planned on us having enough time to drink it,” he replied, coming back to stand in front of you, he brought his hand up to caress your cheek. 

“Huh,” you said, feigning confusion, “what else are you planning on us doing,” you added with a playful smirk. 

“A whole, whole lot of stuff,” he replied, bringing his lips down to meet yours. Your hands came to rest gently on his chest, the material of his shirt was soft and smooth and his skin underneath felt hot. 

You felt his hand take hold of you at the waist, drawing your body flush against his. Chris’s lips moved gently against yours, his tongue brushed against your lips and your parted them willingly, touching your tongue to his. 

You ran your hands up his chest to his shoulders and around the back of his neck, pushing your fingers into his hair. He made a sound deep in his throat has your fingers pushed against his scalp. 

You broke away, keeping your face close to his, breathing deeply, letting the scent of him overwhelm you.

“I like the way you kiss,” you said quietly. 

“Hmm,” he chuckled deep in his chest, “let me show you some other things you might like,”


Next chapter? Full filth. x

“Come on Bubba,” Chris said quietly to Dodger, “Bed time for you,” he said leading Dodger into toward the utility room where his bed was set up. 

“Do you want a glass of wine?” Chris called from the kitchen while you took off your shoes by the door. 

“Yes please,” you called back, making your way down the hall toward the living room, you heard his footsteps on the floor behind you and turned to smile at him. 

Chris handed you a large glass of red wine with a shy smile.  “What do you wanna-” he started, a mischievous look on his face, “Shall we watch something… Or?” he added, cocking his head to the side.

“I would rather we, just, um,” you replied, your voice disappearing into nothing. Chris grinned at you and his cheeks flushed a pretty pink colour which made you smile. 

“After you sweetheart,” he said, motioning down the hall toward the half open door of his bedroom, you made your way toward the door, pushing it open and flicking on the light switch, Chris followed behind you, pushing the door half closed behind himself. 

You stood in the centre of the room, looking around, it wasn’t the first time you’d been in his room, not by a long way, but before you’d been using his en-suite or sleeping off a hangover. You turned to face him and found Chris watching you closely, he took a sip of his wine and set it down on the table close to the door. 

He took two steps toward you, closing the gap between your bodies, “Can I take that for you?” he said, gently taking the glass of wine from your hand. 

“I’ve not had a drink of it yet,” you said, trying to look cross as Chris placed it on the table beside his own. 

“I never planned on us having enough time to drink it,” he replied, coming back to stand in front of you, he brought his hand up to caress your cheek. 

“Huh,” you said, feigning confusion, “what else are you planning on us doing,” you added with a playful smirk. 

“A whole, whole lot of stuff,” he replied, bringing his lips down to meet yours. Your hands came to rest gently on his chest, the material of his shirt was soft and smooth and his skin underneath felt hot. 

You felt his hand take hold of you at the waist, drawing your body flush against his. Chris’s lips moved gently against yours, his tongue brushed against your lips and your parted them willingly, touching your tongue to his. 

You ran your hands up his chest to his shoulders and around the back of his neck, pushing your fingers into his hair. He made a sound deep in his throat has your fingers pushed against his scalp. 

You broke away, keeping your face close to his, breathing deeply, letting the scent of him overwhelm you.

“I like the way you kiss,” you said quietly. 

“Hmm,” he chuckled deep in his chest, “let me show you some other things you might like,”

trail.content:
“’Cause baby it’s a prime time for our love, Ain’t nobody peekin’ but the stars above, It’s a prime time for our love, And heaven is betting on us”

Part 1, Part 2 , Part 3

You seemed to be floating through your days, you moved through the motions without ever really feeling like you were present, you felt as if your heart was elsewhere and you’re absentmindness hadn’t gone unnoticed and on Thursday your boss called you into her office. 

“Sit down, love,” she said with a warm smile. You took a seat across the desk from her, sitting a little awkwardly on the large chair. 

“How are you feeling?” she asked, she watched you closely, her eyes not leaving your face. 

“I’m fine,” you replied easily, it’s what you’d been telling everyone for the last three days, and it wasn’t a lie, you were absolutely fine but also, nothing was fine at all, your manager nodded and smiled sympathetically. 

“Is there anything at home bothering you?” she asked, you knew she was genuinely concerned for you but you found the exchange a little tedious. 

“No, nothing,” you replied, you could tell she wasn’t convinced so you added, “honestly Marie, everything’s fine I’ve just been headachy the last few days,” it was easier to lie about physical ailments that to be honest with her. 

“Okay love,” she said, “you know if anything is troubling you, anything at all, you can tell me right?" 

You nodded and smiled, you couldn’t ask for a more caring manager,but there were some things you couldn’t share, not right now anyway. 

"I know,” you replied with a smile, “and I would come to you,” you added. 

“Okay love,” she repeated, “anything you need,” we reaffirmed before giving you a slight nod that signaled that you were allowed to go back to your desk. 

You floated through the afternoons work and watched the clock relentlessly, watching the minutes tick by until home time. 

Once your work was done for the day you dashed down the office stairs and out into the balmy spring air, it was getting hot and the days were getting longer. The sun still shone brightly and reflected off the glass windows of the building around you. The sun’s warm rays felt like a blessing on your skin as you walked the mile from your office to your home. 

Alone in the cool of your apartment you noticed the answering machine light flashing on the home phone. You frowned, hardly anyone ever called the house phone, if they wanted to talk to you they called your mobile or texted you. Puzzled, you pressed the play button:

Hey sweetheart, your mobile was switched off but I just wanted you to know, I’ll be home early tomorrow morning and I’m taking you out for dinner tomorrow evening okay? Pick you up at 7.30. I thought it would be nice to getting dinner without Dodger trying to steal our food. See you tomorrow,“

Chris’s message sent a shiver from your belly out along your arms and legs to the tips of your toes and fingers. Just knowing he would be back tomorrow made you feel giddy with excitement but it also meant you faced another day just going through the motions and feeling out of place. 

You picked your mobile phone out of your bag and switched it on, you had switched it off when you went into a meeting early that day and it had slipped your mind to turn it back on. There were two missed calls from Chris and a picture of Dodger that he’d sent. 

Friday flashed past, like time had been switched from ultra slow to fast forward, you stood in front of your wardrobe, pushing the clothes around looking for something to wear that evening. 

You finally selected a deep blue knee length dress with a sweetheart neckline, you knew the cut flattered your body and the way it hung on you and made you feel good. The doorbell rang at 7.30 exactly, you pulled open the door, your heart was fluttering and you couldn’t help but grin at Chris standing there. 

He had on a pair of black trousers and a pale blue long sleeve shirt, over his arm he held a soft cream coloured knitted jumper. 

"Hey,” you greeted, a flush traveling up your neck. 

“Hey, you look lovely,” he said, kissing your cheek gently. 

“Looking pretty good yourself,” you replied, stepping aside and allowing him in your apartment, “I’m just going to get my shoes,” you said disappearing into your bedroom to find your shoes and slipping them on your feet. 

“Ready?” you asked, stepping back into the living room.

He nodded and stood, he pulled open the front door and allowed you to step through first, he followed you, stepping aside and allowing you to lock the door. 

He offered you is arm and the two of you walked down the stairs of your apartment block.

“So where are we going?” you asked as the two of you walked toward his car.

“That Italian place that does doesn’t really good baked pastas,” he replied, his voice sounding a little unsure. 

“Perfect, I love that place,” you replied, he pulled open the car door for you and you got in. 

He walked around the front of the vehicle and joined you. He looked over at you and smiled, he placed his hand gently on your bare thigh.

“You do really look lovely tonight,” he said. You knew he was being his absolute gentlemanly best, and he was also so charming. 

“Good enough to eat?” you teased. 

“And then some,” he replied, he turned the key in the ignition and pulled away from the curb. 

Over dinner you shared a bottle of wine and he told you all about his trip to LA, there was some sort of project in the works that he couldn’t tell you much about but he was clearly excited by it. 

As the evening wore on the atmosphere between the two of you seemed to change, it had started off as jokey and flirty, the way things normally were between the two of you, but after your deserts were cleared away, the tone changed, there was a look on his face that you’d not seen before and a tone in his voice that seemed to go straight between your thighs. 

He picked up the cheque and wouldn’t hear a word about you paying for your half of the bill. 

“My treat,” he had said firmly as you had gone to get your purse from your bag.

You had made a sound of protest but he had paid before you had the chance to reply, you had looked at him crossly, he reached across the table and took hold of your hand. 

“Look you,” he had said firmly, “if what we’re planning goes well I’m going to spend the rest of my life owing you for something I can never hope to repay so let me pay for dinner, okay?” his voice had been low and the look in his eyes told you that there would be nothing you could say to change his mind. 

“I’m sorry,” you replied, looking away from his face. 

“You don’t ever have to apologise to me, not for anything,” he said, you looked back and caught his eye, the look in them made your belly quiver. 

“Shall we go? Back to mine?” he added, stroking his fingers over your hand.

“I think so,” you replied, slipping your hand from his grip and standing. You collected your bag and swung the strap over your shoulder. 

Walking out of the restaurant side by side you felt Chris’s hand gently close around hand, his fingers laced through yours, he’s never held your hand like this before and it made your heart flutter. 

The drive back to Chris’s house was quiet and the air between the two of you seemed to crackle with excitement and anticipation. As he pulled out of the parking space Chris brought his hand to rest on your bare thigh, his hand was warm and dry but it sent a cold shiver through your whole body. 

At Chris’s house you were greeted by a very excited Dodger who bounced around the two of you, dashing between you and sniffing excitedly. 

“Come on Bubba,” Chris said quietly to Dodger, “Bed time for you,” he said leading Dodger into toward the utility room where his bed was set up. 

“Do you want a glass of wine?” Chris called from the kitchen while you took off your shoes by the door. 

“Yes please,” you called back, making your way down the hall toward the living room, you heard his footsteps on the floor behind you and turned to smile at him. 

Chris handed you a large glass of red wine with a shy smile.  “What do you wanna-” he started, a mischievous look on his face, “Shall we watch something… Or?” he added, cocking his head to the side.

“I would rather we, just, um,” you replied, your voice disappearing into nothing. Chris grinned at you and his cheeks flushed a pretty pink colour which made you smile. 

“After you sweetheart,” he said, motioning down the hall toward the half open door of his bedroom, you made your way toward the door, pushing it open and flicking on the light switch, Chris followed behind you, pushing the door half closed behind himself. 

You stood in the centre of the room, looking around, it wasn’t the first time you’d been in his room, not by a long way, but before you’d been using his en-suite or sleeping off a hangover. You turned to face him and found Chris watching you closely, he took a sip of his wine and set it down on the table close to the door. 

He took two steps toward you, closing the gap between your bodies, “Can I take that for you?” he said, gently taking the glass of wine from your hand. 

“I’ve not had a drink of it yet,” you said, trying to look cross as Chris placed it on the table beside his own. 

“I never planned on us having enough time to drink it,” he replied, coming back to stand in front of you, he brought his hand up to caress your cheek. 

“Huh,” you said, feigning confusion, “what else are you planning on us doing,” you added with a playful smirk. 

“A whole, whole lot of stuff,” he replied, bringing his lips down to meet yours. Your hands came to rest gently on his chest, the material of his shirt was soft and smooth and his skin underneath felt hot. 

You felt his hand take hold of you at the waist, drawing your body flush against his. Chris’s lips moved gently against yours, his tongue brushed against your lips and your parted them willingly, touching your tongue to his. 

You ran your hands up his chest to his shoulders and around the back of his neck, pushing your fingers into his hair. He made a sound deep in his throat has your fingers pushed against his scalp. 

You broke away, keeping your face close to his, breathing deeply, letting the scent of him overwhelm you.

“I like the way you kiss,” you said quietly. 

“Hmm,” he chuckled deep in his chest, “let me show you some other things you might like,”

blog.description: *Formerly @anrm1* Writer. Reader. Tom Hardy trash. Nice to meet you. Wattpad- @NicoleMarshh Fics

title: A Taste of Home
body:
CHAPTER 2

Catch up on Chapter 1

(many hugs, and thank you’s to @miidailyinspiration for the help on my face claim for Amelia. You’ve helped put my indecisive mind to rest, love!)

Casual, but not sloppy. Sophisticated, but not stuffy. This was no ordinary to-do, and you weren’t about to make light of the situation at hand.

To add to stresses of attire, your mother had found the whole thing to be so “cute,” and some twisted little cell of her excitement thought it a necessity to call his mother and cackle about the nostalgia of it all.

By some circumstances you were unsure of, your cell number had somehow fallen into his lap, and the day you were supposed to head towards to outskirts of the Boston tree line, he had texted you details.

C: Picking up a bottle of wine for tonight. Preference? You name it.

Y/N: How about a red?

C: Anything for the guest of honor. See you around 8!

Attached to his last reply, was a syrup sweet selfie that made you want to punch someone just to kill off some of the nauseating lovability, of he and the famous pup you’d seen often on his socials.

You didn’t know where to begin with preparation, nor exactly what to prepare for, and the day passed on like the speed of a changing season so your mental torture could lag on. A quick color and blow-out at the salon was never a wrong turn, and a trip to the mall couldn’t hurt matters.

Silencing your phone, and securing the doors of your car with two deeps, your knees wobbled like a feeble fawn towards the front steps. It was extravagant, but not in an “I’m better than you” type of way, and it’s woodsy endearment was the coziness your nerves needed.

Taking the steps one by one, hearing a dogs roaring bark behind the solid oak of his front door, a thought was conceived.

Was this… a booty call? Do people even know what that is anymore? Had you been invited to the quiet forest around his home, to glug too much wine, stroll down memory lane, and wind up on your back?

The more troubling conclusion, being you weren’t sure the idea sounded half bad….

There’d have to be some self-respect. Your shambling life left no room for any more error, and you wouldn’t fall into such handsome traps that easily.

Using the pane of glass that lined the entry as a reflection check, the door was pulled open, letting the interior nose of music and galloping steps of Dodger loose.

You cursed mentally when you stuck your hand inside the lining of your light jacket to feel the mint still wrapped that you had forgotten to chew on the drive over.

The handsome pups’ leash was held onto by an even more handsome man, and both of them seem quite eager to greet you. However, one more interested in sniffing around your shoes and backside.

“Woah, Dodge! Let’s mind our manners, boy.” His owner laughed with squinted eyes.

He met you with an unexpected, one arm embrace. His fingers snuck under the hem of your breezy springtime cardigan, and rested sprawled across the silk camisole covering the small of your back. Your cheeks brushed together at the ensuing of his gentle, platonic kiss to your face, and his beard felt softer than you would’ve imagined.

“Glad you could sneak away to hang out.”

“Thanks for the invitation. This place is stunning.” You barely recognized your own voice as it’s tone stuttered and dropped into some weird, sad excuse for seductive key.

Jealous at how effortlessly he could barely graze your skin and have you wanting to shout his name in an explicit context, you rustled your hair to swing its vanilla scented sweetness toward him, trying your own much more forced hand at seduction.

With smiling eyes, he gestured you through the front door, leading the way into the foyer. The simple brightness of its monochromatic scheme added an appealing cleanliness and homey feel. A grand piano was nestled near the fireplace, and a candle of spicy sweetness flickered on the white mantle as you heard Dodgers leash clang against a metal coat rack.

“Do you still play?” You asked running a finger over the glossy top of the black instrument positioned on a patterned rug.

His skinned turned red behind the protection of his grizzly beard, and he squeezed his palm to the back of his neck. The loose cotton of his shirt teased up his belly, gifting you with the sight of a meaty, perfectly exercised torso. Your eyes dilated with zealous desire at the way a trail of light hair trailed beneath the band of his relaxed blue jeans.

“I do, yeah. Badly, but I do. I don’t get as much practice as I’d like. Get me drunk enough & maybe I’ll play you something.”

Still the same old guy. The tortured musician with a home on the stage, and a healthy liking to beer.

“Speaking of, I’m heading to the kitchen for a drink. Glass of wine?” He walked in reverse down the hall, offering you up a beverage.

“Sounds perfect. It better not be the cheap shit either, Evans. I know how you operate.” You bit your tongue at the bold banter of your sarcasm. But, it wasn’t as if he didn’t know your true colors. He’d known you since school age, and if he was willing to still speak to your after your raging ugly-duckling stages of junior high, surely he could handle a witty tongue.

When he disappeared behind the wall of the kitchen and glasses clinked, and the cabinets slammed, you helped yourself to sight seeing around the empty den. Photos of he and castmates, his nephews and nieces school portraits, and some exquisite artwork decorated the walls, alongside the glorious steel shield you’d seen on the big screen. The life of riches, and fame hadn’t rotted through to who he really was yet it seemed, and you admired the simplicity of his private life.

“I’ll let you touch it for the right price,” he snuck in undetected from the left, long-stem swirling in one hand, and an already half-empty beer bottle in the other.

You eagerly grasped at the wine he had poured for you, desperately pining for something to center your weak knees from his closeness. Grazing across his full fingertips, your hormones began to dance.

“Excuse you?” For a brief moment, unsure of what exactly his cheeky comment suggested, you coughed in shock.

“The shield, Amelia. Don’t make me out to be an asshole here, kid.” Chris rolled his eyes with a faux grin, struggling to hide the slightest bit of insult from your insinuations.

Wait, kid? No, no, no. For one, 29, divorced, and your own insurance plan hardly classified you in the kid category. And the boobs. C’mon, Evans. Didn’t you see the boobs?

“However, I think the term kid need no longer apply…”

Did he hear your thoughts? Could he read minds now? He’s Captain America. Of course he could. Your thoughts heckled you.

Abruptly set on actual fire at the way his eyes painted over you like daggers memorizing your every curve, you choked up a dousing gulp of wine, and it dribbled down your rounded chin. He caught the beads of dark Merlot pooling at the corner of your lips with his thumb, then quite accidentally erotically, sucked the liquid from his finger with a pop of his half-smiling lips.

“Still as elegant as ever, I see.” Chris winked, and pulled an open-mouth sip of his sweating bottle of ale.

Bury your head in a hole full of poisonous scorpions, or plunge from a plane with no parachute? Both scenarios seemed like a fitting death for the embarrassment boiling throughout your pulsing veins.

“I resent that. I didn’t even trip up a single stair on the way in, thank you very much, sir.” Your hair toppled over your shoulder with your sassy, matter-of-fact head bob. The loose strand falling airily into your face.

“You’re so right. Seems little Mil is all grown up and coordinated now.” He reached for the lock of your hair in an instant, like he couldn’t resist its’ touch, and twirled it around his pointer finger only once, or twice before pushing it from your eyes.

The room went silent then, and spun with the drunken tension of unexplained passion. You wondered if this whole façade was some sort of sick way for his ego to get off, or had word gotten around to him about your less than happy fortune, and he pitied you, and old friend, in some way? Sure, you could put an outfit together in less then 5 minutes like nobody’s business, and you weren’t exactly a bore to be around. But you were such a… a simpleton compared to him in every sense. Often stringy, dull blonde hair no matter what “shine shampoo” you paid for. Your legs not even half the length of an average sized woman, and you were barely tall enough to reach the pedals of a car. A tiny, blonde, plain-faced woman with the occasional humorous comeback. Nowhere near the realm of anything he deserved.

He never broke his laser, blue-eyed stare with yours when he stretched blindly the empty his hand of the bottle, placing it to rest on top of the piano behind you. They color looping around his pupils was like your own lustful swimming pool where you wanted to float wearing nothing but a smile. The rounded point of your chest touched his when he leaned past you, and you prayed the thin lace of your unlined bra was just enough to hide the gentle bud of your breast. You were sure the news of the split with your husband was indeed knowledge to him, because he wasn’t the type to ever sink to the level of pursing a taken woman.

But, was this that? Was the closeness of his body, and his ruthless, studying stares his idea of pursuit? Or was your needy, wishful thinking playing tricks on you?

“I see the tan line on your finger, but the ring is missing?” You couldn’t make sense of his words as a question, or a statement.

“I’m sure you’ve heard more than I would have liked for you to, Chris…”

He gently squeezed at your teeny bicep, his head ghosting a nod just before you dropped to shamefully examine your feet.

“I did hear some stuff. But, it came directly from your moms mouth. Well, straight from your moms mouth, then my moms who she told.” He smiled to alleviate your stresses. “But, if you wanna talk, I’ll listen, Amelia.”

You wanted to. Oh, how curiously bad you wanted to. Something in the velvet ease of his voice willed you cry, and confess, and vent your broken hearts every desperate pain, and you had no idea why. He was a familiar face, but one from the past. You’d lived an entire life since the two of you had last seen the other, and yet something around his eyes hypnotized you to confide there like a terrified stow-away, running from the harshness your reality.

Just as your lips parted, and you’d carefully allowed only one tear to totter on the edge of your eyelid, the yelps of an observant dog startled you both. Dodger stood on his hind legs, peeping and panting as he stared out the open curtain of a bay window.

“Shit Dodger. Calm down boy, it’s fine.” Chris dropped his hold on you to settle the curious animal. “Everyone else is here. Late as usual.” He remarked.

“Everyone?”

“Yeah, some of the guys are coming to watch the game tonight. You’ll remember most of them. Their wives, too! When I saw you the other day, I knew I had to invite you out to visit with everybody since you’re back here now. Thought it would be cool for everyone to catch up, ya’ know?” The man casually explained as he strolled towards the entryway.

Stupid you. Always stupid, stupid you. Of course, this wasn’t a date. He didn’t want to date you. Not now, not ever. You fluffed your mess of curls, and paid for yet another outfit you didn’t need simply for nothing. But, the outfit was charged to a credit card in your wallet still under the name of your oh, so generous, soon-to-be ex-husband, who you were sure wouldn’t mind. So, that part wasn’t exactly a problem.

The signs had been all there though, right? The wine he’d asked you about. The sinful way he whispered and teased into your ear? It definitely seemed flirtatious in the most welcomed of manner. Or, maybe you just desperately wanted it to feel that way. Did your ego subconsciously create the boost it needed?

“Mills? Hey, you in there? Amelia?” He pleaded you from your daydreaming state as you swayed on your feet due to the thoughtful coma you were entranced in.

“There’s not a problem is there, sweetheart?”

“No, no. God, no! Not at all! It’s great, yeah. I’m excited to see them.” Your words wavered a little, battling the line of truth and lie.

It wouldn’t be so bad to see some familiar faces, and maybe rekindled some friendships now that you had waywardly returned. But, the scoop neckline of your slinky tank couldn’t hide the wave of blushing, blind disappointment climbing your chest. A result of how you felt about having to share him with others. As if he was yours to share.

People welcomed themselves in, some toting 6-packs, a brown sack marked with the logo of a bakery downtown that you knew created all things scrumptious, so you’d have to get into the good graces of the woman you didn’t recognize carrying it towards the kitchen. The faces had changed, but a handful of them still had those same smiles, or telling eyes from the past, and they appeared strangely excited to see you. Especially Tucker, someone closer to your age who had grown close to Chris through tap classes. The only other person on the planet who was informed on your most secret desires for the handsome Evans in question.

He nearly sprinted towards you, cradling your now squished, reddened cheeks in his hands. Your nose crinkled and eyes rolled with nothing but the truest joy at his fanatical greetings.

“Well, well. If our girl isn’t where all her little wet dreams from 15-years-ago unraveled, hm? Assuming you have been up to his bedroom already?” Tucker pinched your bottom playfully, murmuring into the hollow of your ear.

“Oh, give me some credit, Tuck! What kinda girl do you think I am?!!”

“One who has wanted a slice of that man since we were 13, Amelia. That’s who.”

God, he wasn’t wrong. He was the farthest left from anything resembling wrong, and it made the contents of your stomach swimming with the heavy red wine want to escape. You didn’t trust yourself to keep it together with Chris, and hold on to even the tiniest little remnant of your dignity. Your gut knew all he had to do was say the word, and you’d go skipping into his bed like most eager of beavers. But, God. You wanted him to say the word……

A/N: I hope you guys are enjoying. This one is a bit unnerving for me, and my readers are used to Hardy content. Your feedback is always welcomed with open arms! Again, let me know if you’d like to me added, or removed from the tag-list! xx
