Was this… a booty call? Do people even know what that is anymore? Had you been invited to the quiet forest around his home, to glug too much wine, stroll down memory lane, and wind up on your back?

The more troubling conclusion, being you weren’t sure the idea sounded half bad….

There’d have to be some self-respect. Your shambling life left no room for any more error, and you wouldn’t fall into such handsome traps that easily.

Using the pane of glass that lined the entry as a reflection check, the door was pulled open, letting the interior nose of music and galloping steps of Dodger loose.

You cursed mentally when you stuck your hand inside the lining of your light jacket to feel the mint still wrapped that you had forgotten to chew on the drive over.

The handsome pups’ leash was held onto by an even more handsome man, and both of them seem quite eager to greet you. However, one more interested in sniffing around your shoes and backside.

“Woah, Dodge! Let’s mind our manners, boy.” His owner laughed with squinted eyes.

He met you with an unexpected, one arm embrace. His fingers snuck under the hem of your breezy springtime cardigan, and rested sprawled across the silk camisole covering the small of your back. Your cheeks brushed together at the ensuing of his gentle, platonic kiss to your face, and his beard felt softer than you would’ve imagined.

“Glad you could sneak away to hang out.”

“Thanks for the invitation. This place is stunning.” You barely recognized your own voice as it’s tone stuttered and dropped into some weird, sad excuse for seductive key.

Jealous at how effortlessly he could barely graze your skin and have you wanting to shout his name in an explicit context, you rustled your hair to swing its vanilla scented sweetness toward him, trying your own much more forced hand at seduction.

With smiling eyes, he gestured you through the front door, leading the way into the foyer. The simple brightness of its monochromatic scheme added an appealing cleanliness and homey feel. A grand piano was nestled near the fireplace, and a candle of spicy sweetness flickered on the white mantle as you heard Dodgers leash clang against a metal coat rack.

“Do you still play?” You asked running a finger over the glossy top of the black instrument positioned on a patterned rug.

His skinned turned red behind the protection of his grizzly beard, and he squeezed his palm to the back of his neck. The loose cotton of his shirt teased up his belly, gifting you with the sight of a meaty, perfectly exercised torso. Your eyes dilated with zealous desire at the way a trail of light hair trailed beneath the band of his relaxed blue jeans.

“I do, yeah. Badly, but I do. I don’t get as much practice as I’d like. Get me drunk enough & maybe I’ll play you something.”

Still the same old guy. The tortured musician with a home on the stage, and a healthy liking to beer.

“Speaking of, I’m heading to the kitchen for a drink. Glass of wine?” He walked in reverse down the hall, offering you up a beverage.

“Sounds perfect. It better not be the cheap shit either, Evans. I know how you operate.” You bit your tongue at the bold banter of your sarcasm. But, it wasn’t as if he didn’t know your true colors. He’d known you since school age, and if he was willing to still speak to your after your raging ugly-duckling stages of junior high, surely he could handle a witty tongue.

When he disappeared behind the wall of the kitchen and glasses clinked, and the cabinets slammed, you helped yourself to sight seeing around the empty den. Photos of he and castmates, his nephews and nieces school portraits, and some exquisite artwork decorated the walls, alongside the glorious steel shield you’d seen on the big screen. The life of riches, and fame hadn’t rotted through to who he really was yet it seemed, and you admired the simplicity of his private life.

“I’ll let you touch it for the right price,” he snuck in undetected from the left, long-stem swirling in one hand, and an already half-empty beer bottle in the other.

You eagerly grasped at the wine he had poured for you, desperately pining for something to center your weak knees from his closeness. Grazing across his full fingertips, your hormones began to dance.

“Excuse you?” For a brief moment, unsure of what exactly his cheeky comment suggested, you coughed in shock.

“The shield, Amelia. Don’t make me out to be an asshole here, kid.” Chris rolled his eyes with a faux grin, struggling to hide the slightest bit of insult from your insinuations.

Wait, kid? No, no, no. For one, 29, divorced, and your own insurance plan hardly classified you in the kid category. And the boobs. C’mon, Evans. Didn’t you see the boobs?

“However, I think the term kid need no longer apply…”

Did he hear your thoughts? Could he read minds now? He’s Captain America. Of course he could. Your thoughts heckled you.

Abruptly set on actual fire at the way his eyes painted over you like daggers memorizing your every curve, you choked up a dousing gulp of wine, and it dribbled down your rounded chin. He caught the beads of dark Merlot pooling at the corner of your lips with his thumb, then quite accidentally erotically, sucked the liquid from his finger with a pop of his half-smiling lips.

“Still as elegant as ever, I see.” Chris winked, and pulled an open-mouth sip of his sweating bottle of ale.

Bury your head in a hole full of poisonous scorpions, or plunge from a plane with no parachute? Both scenarios seemed like a fitting death for the embarrassment boiling throughout your pulsing veins.

“I resent that. I didn’t even trip up a single stair on the way in, thank you very much, sir.” Your hair toppled over your shoulder with your sassy, matter-of-fact head bob. The loose strand falling airily into your face.

“You’re so right. Seems little Mil is all grown up and coordinated now.” He reached for the lock of your hair in an instant, like he couldn’t resist its’ touch, and twirled it around his pointer finger only once, or twice before pushing it from your eyes.

The room went silent then, and spun with the drunken tension of unexplained passion. You wondered if this whole façade was some sort of sick way for his ego to get off, or had word gotten around to him about your less than happy fortune, and he pitied you, and old friend, in some way? Sure, you could put an outfit together in less then 5 minutes like nobody’s business, and you weren’t exactly a bore to be around. But you were such a… a simpleton compared to him in every sense. Often stringy, dull blonde hair no matter what “shine shampoo” you paid for. Your legs not even half the length of an average sized woman, and you were barely tall enough to reach the pedals of a car. A tiny, blonde, plain-faced woman with the occasional humorous comeback. Nowhere near the realm of anything he deserved.

He never broke his laser, blue-eyed stare with yours when he stretched blindly the empty his hand of the bottle, placing it to rest on top of the piano behind you. They color looping around his pupils was like your own lustful swimming pool where you wanted to float wearing nothing but a smile. The rounded point of your chest touched his when he leaned past you, and you prayed the thin lace of your unlined bra was just enough to hide the gentle bud of your breast. You were sure the news of the split with your husband was indeed knowledge to him, because he wasn’t the type to ever sink to the level of pursing a taken woman.

But, was this that? Was the closeness of his body, and his ruthless, studying stares his idea of pursuit? Or was your needy, wishful thinking playing tricks on you?

“I see the tan line on your finger, but the ring is missing?” You couldn’t make sense of his words as a question, or a statement.

“I’m sure you’ve heard more than I would have liked for you to, Chris…”

He gently squeezed at your teeny bicep, his head ghosting a nod just before you dropped to shamefully examine your feet.

“I did hear some stuff. But, it came directly from your moms mouth. Well, straight from your moms mouth, then my moms who she told.” He smiled to alleviate your stresses. “But, if you wanna talk, I’ll listen, Amelia.”

You wanted to. Oh, how curiously bad you wanted to. Something in the velvet ease of his voice willed you cry, and confess, and vent your broken hearts every desperate pain, and you had no idea why. He was a familiar face, but one from the past. You’d lived an entire life since the two of you had last seen the other, and yet something around his eyes hypnotized you to confide there like a terrified stow-away, running from the harshness your reality.

Just as your lips parted, and you’d carefully allowed only one tear to totter on the edge of your eyelid, the yelps of an observant dog startled you both. Dodger stood on his hind legs, peeping and panting as he stared out the open curtain of a bay window.

“Shit Dodger. Calm down boy, it’s fine.” Chris dropped his hold on you to settle the curious animal. “Everyone else is here. Late as usual.” He remarked.

“Everyone?”

“Yeah, some of the guys are coming to watch the game tonight. You’ll remember most of them. Their wives, too! When I saw you the other day, I knew I had to invite you out to visit with everybody since you’re back here now. Thought it would be cool for everyone to catch up, ya’ know?” The man casually explained as he strolled towards the entryway.

Stupid you. Always stupid, stupid you. Of course, this wasn’t a date. He didn’t want to date you. Not now, not ever. You fluffed your mess of curls, and paid for yet another outfit you didn’t need simply for nothing. But, the outfit was charged to a credit card in your wallet still under the name of your oh, so generous, soon-to-be ex-husband, who you were sure wouldn’t mind. So, that part wasn’t exactly a problem.

The signs had been all there though, right? The wine he’d asked you about. The sinful way he whispered and teased into your ear? It definitely seemed flirtatious in the most welcomed of manner. Or, maybe you just desperately wanted it to feel that way. Did your ego subconsciously create the boost it needed?

“Mills? Hey, you in there? Amelia?” He pleaded you from your daydreaming state as you swayed on your feet due to the thoughtful coma you were entranced in.

“There’s not a problem is there, sweetheart?”

“No, no. God, no! Not at all! It’s great, yeah. I’m excited to see them.” Your words wavered a little, battling the line of truth and lie.

It wouldn’t be so bad to see some familiar faces, and maybe rekindled some friendships now that you had waywardly returned. But, the scoop neckline of your slinky tank couldn’t hide the wave of blushing, blind disappointment climbing your chest. A result of how you felt about having to share him with others. As if he was yours to share.

People welcomed themselves in, some toting 6-packs, a brown sack marked with the logo of a bakery downtown that you knew created all things scrumptious, so you’d have to get into the good graces of the woman you didn’t recognize carrying it towards the kitchen. The faces had changed, but a handful of them still had those same smiles, or telling eyes from the past, and they appeared strangely excited to see you. Especially Tucker, someone closer to your age who had grown close to Chris through tap classes. The only other person on the planet who was informed on your most secret desires for the handsome Evans in question.

He nearly sprinted towards you, cradling your now squished, reddened cheeks in his hands. Your nose crinkled and eyes rolled with nothing but the truest joy at his fanatical greetings.

“Well, well. If our girl isn’t where all her little wet dreams from 15-years-ago unraveled, hm? Assuming you have been up to his bedroom already?” Tucker pinched your bottom playfully, murmuring into the hollow of your ear.

“Oh, give me some credit, Tuck! What kinda girl do you think I am?!!”

“One who has wanted a slice of that man since we were 13, Amelia. That’s who.”

God, he wasn’t wrong. He was the farthest left from anything resembling wrong, and it made the contents of your stomach swimming with the heavy red wine want to escape. You didn’t trust yourself to keep it together with Chris, and hold on to even the tiniest little remnant of your dignity. Your gut knew all he had to do was say the word, and you’d go skipping into his bed like most eager of beavers. But, God. You wanted him to say the word……

A/N: I hope you guys are enjoying. This one is a bit unnerving for me, and my readers are used to Hardy content. Your feedback is always welcomed with open arms! Again, let me know if you’d like to me added, or removed from the tag-list! xx

“I do, yeah. Badly, but I do. I don’t get as much practice as I’d like. Get me drunk enough & maybe I’ll play you something.”

Still the same old guy. The tortured musician with a home on the stage, and a healthy liking to beer.

“Speaking of, I’m heading to the kitchen for a drink. Glass of wine?” He walked in reverse down the hall, offering you up a beverage.

“Sounds perfect. It better not be the cheap shit either, Evans. I know how you operate.” You bit your tongue at the bold banter of your sarcasm. But, it wasn’t as if he didn’t know your true colors. He’d known you since school age, and if he was willing to still speak to your after your raging ugly-duckling stages of junior high, surely he could handle a witty tongue.

When he disappeared behind the wall of the kitchen and glasses clinked, and the cabinets slammed, you helped yourself to sight seeing around the empty den. Photos of he and castmates, his nephews and nieces school portraits, and some exquisite artwork decorated the walls, alongside the glorious steel shield you’d seen on the big screen. The life of riches, and fame hadn’t rotted through to who he really was yet it seemed, and you admired the simplicity of his private life.

“I’ll let you touch it for the right price,” he snuck in undetected from the left, long-stem swirling in one hand, and an already half-empty beer bottle in the other.

You eagerly grasped at the wine he had poured for you, desperately pining for something to center your weak knees from his closeness. Grazing across his full fingertips, your hormones began to dance.

“Excuse you?” For a brief moment, unsure of what exactly his cheeky comment suggested, you coughed in shock.

“The shield, Amelia. Don’t make me out to be an asshole here, kid.” Chris rolled his eyes with a faux grin, struggling to hide the slightest bit of insult from your insinuations.

Wait, kid? No, no, no. For one, 29, divorced, and your own insurance plan hardly classified you in the kid category. And the boobs. C’mon, Evans. Didn’t you see the boobs?

“However, I think the term kid need no longer apply…”

Did he hear your thoughts? Could he read minds now? He’s Captain America. Of course he could. Your thoughts heckled you.

Abruptly set on actual fire at the way his eyes painted over you like daggers memorizing your every curve, you choked up a dousing gulp of wine, and it dribbled down your rounded chin. He caught the beads of dark Merlot pooling at the corner of your lips with his thumb, then quite accidentally erotically, sucked the liquid from his finger with a pop of his half-smiling lips.

“Still as elegant as ever, I see.” Chris winked, and pulled an open-mouth sip of his sweating bottle of ale.

Bury your head in a hole full of poisonous scorpions, or plunge from a plane with no parachute? Both scenarios seemed like a fitting death for the embarrassment boiling throughout your pulsing veins.

“I resent that. I didn’t even trip up a single stair on the way in, thank you very much, sir.” Your hair toppled over your shoulder with your sassy, matter-of-fact head bob. The loose strand falling airily into your face.

“You’re so right. Seems little Mil is all grown up and coordinated now.” He reached for the lock of your hair in an instant, like he couldn’t resist its’ touch, and twirled it around his pointer finger only once, or twice before pushing it from your eyes.

The room went silent then, and spun with the drunken tension of unexplained passion. You wondered if this whole façade was some sort of sick way for his ego to get off, or had word gotten around to him about your less than happy fortune, and he pitied you, and old friend, in some way? Sure, you could put an outfit together in less then 5 minutes like nobody’s business, and you weren’t exactly a bore to be around. But you were such a… a simpleton compared to him in every sense. Often stringy, dull blonde hair no matter what “shine shampoo” you paid for. Your legs not even half the length of an average sized woman, and you were barely tall enough to reach the pedals of a car. A tiny, blonde, plain-faced woman with the occasional humorous comeback. Nowhere near the realm of anything he deserved.

He never broke his laser, blue-eyed stare with yours when he stretched blindly the empty his hand of the bottle, placing it to rest on top of the piano behind you. They color looping around his pupils was like your own lustful swimming pool where you wanted to float wearing nothing but a smile. The rounded point of your chest touched his when he leaned past you, and you prayed the thin lace of your unlined bra was just enough to hide the gentle bud of your breast. You were sure the news of the split with your husband was indeed knowledge to him, because he wasn’t the type to ever sink to the level of pursing a taken woman.

But, was this that? Was the closeness of his body, and his ruthless, studying stares his idea of pursuit? Or was your needy, wishful thinking playing tricks on you?

“I see the tan line on your finger, but the ring is missing?” You couldn’t make sense of his words as a question, or a statement.

“I’m sure you’ve heard more than I would have liked for you to, Chris…”

He gently squeezed at your teeny bicep, his head ghosting a nod just before you dropped to shamefully examine your feet.

“I did hear some stuff. But, it came directly from your moms mouth. Well, straight from your moms mouth, then my moms who she told.” He smiled to alleviate your stresses. “But, if you wanna talk, I’ll listen, Amelia.”

You wanted to. Oh, how curiously bad you wanted to. Something in the velvet ease of his voice willed you cry, and confess, and vent your broken hearts every desperate pain, and you had no idea why. He was a familiar face, but one from the past. You’d lived an entire life since the two of you had last seen the other, and yet something around his eyes hypnotized you to confide there like a terrified stow-away, running from the harshness your reality.

Just as your lips parted, and you’d carefully allowed only one tear to totter on the edge of your eyelid, the yelps of an observant dog startled you both. Dodger stood on his hind legs, peeping and panting as he stared out the open curtain of a bay window.

“Shit Dodger. Calm down boy, it’s fine.” Chris dropped his hold on you to settle the curious animal. “Everyone else is here. Late as usual.” He remarked.

“Everyone?”

“Yeah, some of the guys are coming to watch the game tonight. You’ll remember most of them. Their wives, too! When I saw you the other day, I knew I had to invite you out to visit with everybody since you’re back here now. Thought it would be cool for everyone to catch up, ya’ know?” The man casually explained as he strolled towards the entryway.

Stupid you. Always stupid, stupid you. Of course, this wasn’t a date. He didn’t want to date you. Not now, not ever. You fluffed your mess of curls, and paid for yet another outfit you didn’t need simply for nothing. But, the outfit was charged to a credit card in your wallet still under the name of your oh, so generous, soon-to-be ex-husband, who you were sure wouldn’t mind. So, that part wasn’t exactly a problem.

The signs had been all there though, right? The wine he’d asked you about. The sinful way he whispered and teased into your ear? It definitely seemed flirtatious in the most welcomed of manner. Or, maybe you just desperately wanted it to feel that way. Did your ego subconsciously create the boost it needed?

“Mills? Hey, you in there? Amelia?” He pleaded you from your daydreaming state as you swayed on your feet due to the thoughtful coma you were entranced in.

“There’s not a problem is there, sweetheart?”

“No, no. God, no! Not at all! It’s great, yeah. I’m excited to see them.” Your words wavered a little, battling the line of truth and lie.

It wouldn’t be so bad to see some familiar faces, and maybe rekindled some friendships now that you had waywardly returned. But, the scoop neckline of your slinky tank couldn’t hide the wave of blushing, blind disappointment climbing your chest. A result of how you felt about having to share him with others. As if he was yours to share.

People welcomed themselves in, some toting 6-packs, a brown sack marked with the logo of a bakery downtown that you knew created all things scrumptious, so you’d have to get into the good graces of the woman you didn’t recognize carrying it towards the kitchen. The faces had changed, but a handful of them still had those same smiles, or telling eyes from the past, and they appeared strangely excited to see you. Especially Tucker, someone closer to your age who had grown close to Chris through tap classes. The only other person on the planet who was informed on your most secret desires for the handsome Evans in question.

He nearly sprinted towards you, cradling your now squished, reddened cheeks in his hands. Your nose crinkled and eyes rolled with nothing but the truest joy at his fanatical greetings.

“Well, well. If our girl isn’t where all her little wet dreams from 15-years-ago unraveled, hm? Assuming you have been up to his bedroom already?” Tucker pinched your bottom playfully, murmuring into the hollow of your ear.

“Oh, give me some credit, Tuck! What kinda girl do you think I am?!!”

“One who has wanted a slice of that man since we were 13, Amelia. That’s who.”

God, he wasn’t wrong. He was the farthest left from anything resembling wrong, and it made the contents of your stomach swimming with the heavy red wine want to escape. You didn’t trust yourself to keep it together with Chris, and hold on to even the tiniest little remnant of your dignity. Your gut knew all he had to do was say the word, and you’d go skipping into his bed like most eager of beavers. But, God. You wanted him to say the word……

A/N: I hope you guys are enjoying. This one is a bit unnerving for me, and my readers are used to Hardy content. Your feedback is always welcomed with open arms! Again, let me know if you’d like to me added, or removed from the tag-list! xx

Casual, but not sloppy. Sophisticated, but not stuffy. This was no ordinary to-do, and you weren’t about to make light of the situation at hand.

To add to stresses of attire, your mother had found the whole thing to be so “cute,” and some twisted little cell of her excitement thought it a necessity to call his mother and cackle about the nostalgia of it all.

By some circumstances you were unsure of, your cell number had somehow fallen into his lap, and the day you were supposed to head towards to outskirts of the Boston tree line, he had texted you details.

summary: Mr. Evans- Chris Evans AU Chapter Eight
title: Mr. Evans- Chris Evans AU Chapter Eight
body:
Teacher!Chris Evans x Student!Reader

Warnings: TeacherxStudent relationship. Slightly Underage reader x adult teacher. Mild smut. Explicit language cause of course. Mild fluff.

Disclaimers: I don’t own  “Party In The U.S.A.” (lmaoo). I also don’t own CE or you. I don’t condone any relationship of this kind. This is for fictional and entertainment purposes only. 

A/N: Um…so I’m particularly nervous for this one cause I got a little more spicy with my wording and overall vibes. Just be gentle, please? I’m not used to writing this…

Word Count: 5, 524 words

Read Chapter Seven Here!!

*

(Gif isn’t mine!)

You would’ve thought the fact that Mr. Evans was the one who went in, knight armor glimmering heroically under the party lights, and saved you from the gross human being that was James McDaniels would’ve shocked the drunkness right out of you, but all it did was make your head spin even more rapidly.

“What the hell are you doing here?” You can’t help but slur in a mumble.

Mr. Evans digs his fingers tightly into the soft skin of your thighs, lips parting with a large exhale.

“I could ask you the same question sweetheart,” he practically growls, turning a sharp corner and concealing both of you from the probing eyes at the party.

You giggle a little, nuzzling his neck and breathing in his intoxicating scent. “I wanted to have some fun.”

You feel his chest rise and shakily fall as he releases a trembling breath then laughs. “You’re just full of them aren’t you?”

You look up at him, frowning. “Them?”

He bites his lip to hold back a big goofy smile but fails miserably. “Surprises. You’re full of surprises, sweetheart.”

You press your lips to the nape of his neck lightly and mumble gently into the soft skin. “Am I?”

He swallows hard and you feel his big warm hands lightly shaking on your skin.

“Oh, you’re nothing but trouble Ms. Y/l/n,” he practically rasps, his voice strained and husky.

Uncaring if you’re crossing any lines even by simply being in his presence right now, you laugh softly, pressing closer to his warm chest and letting out a content sigh.

You break away from him, looking up at his face. “Thank you,” you manage to say sincerely through your drunken gaze. “For saving me, I mean.”

He clears his throat. “I wasn’t going to let him touch you like that.”

You shudder in his arms at the thought of whatever it was that James was planning to do with you. “He misunderstood my intentions with him. I only danced with him because it seemed like fun a fun thing to do at the time. But that’s all it was. Dancing. And I let him touch me a bit because I thought it was innocent. But then he didn’t want to stop when I told him to.”

At this, all signs of lust and humor are gone from his face and he halts his brisk walk in the middle of a lonely street.

You furrow your brows confusedly at him as he sets you down on the ground gently. You hold onto his neck for support as your legs wobble slightly before entirely untangling yourself from him.

The street is completely pitch black aside from a single streetlight which only illuminates half of both of you.

“You can walk on your own from here on out. My car’s only a few blocks away,” he mumbles coldly over his shoulder at you, stalking ahead.

You raise a brow at his sudden shift in attitude. “Okay…” you mumble to yourself, clumsily stumbling on behind him.

It only takes a few minutes of you consistently cursing your drunkness and heels for your inability to walk properly before Mr. Evans stops walking abruptly, causing you to crash head-first against his strong back. You grunt when your nose gets crushed on his firm muscles.

“Ow!” You stumble back, rubbing the sore spot frantically in an attempt to massage the ache away.

When you look back up at him, though, you’re shocked to find that he’s taken his sunglasses off, bright blue eyes now glaring holes into you.

“What the hell were you even thinking Y/n? Huh!?” He hisses.

You blink at him slowly, whiplashing at his sudden change in demeanor. “Wha-what do you mean?”

He laughs dryly, jabbing an angry finger directly at you. “Oh my- I mean that I literally just had to pry off and beat the living hell out of one of my goddam students for you!”

You raise an indignant brow at his accusatory tone. Like this was somehow your fucking fault.

“And that’s my fault, how exactly?”

He scoffs. “Well, You came alone to a fucking party, for starters. I mean,” he licks his lips, laughing humorlessly. “What girl your age fucking does that!?”

“I didn’t! Margo had to leave early for a family emergency,” you quickly defend before quietly adding; “and you didn’t have to beat James up like that.”

He runs his long fingers through his hair making his hoodie fall off and licks his lips in pure frustration again.

“I didn’t have- I didn’t have to beat James up like that!” He laughs darkly mocking your statement before looking down at you incredulously.

“He was putting his damn hands on you sweetheart! He was going to drag you off to god-knows-where to-“ he instantly cuts himself off, sucking in a sharp breath. His eyes screw shut and his jaw clenches tightly, ticking.

“Shit, just thinking about it makes me wanna go back in there to finish what I started,” he growls so low under his breath that if it wasn’t for the isolation of the place you were in, you wouldn’t have been able to hear him.

His eyes turn to you once more, the heat of his anger warming your skin as he slowly moves in, stalking up to you with avid, determined steps.  

“So yes, I did have to beat him up like that. Because he’s a goddam scum bag who shouldn’t be forcing himself on girls. Especially you!”

He’s completely red in the face, the veins of his neck prominently protruding from his neck as well as from his forehead.

“Me?” you pause, frowning in confusion at him.

He freezes as well and for a second, an expression that screamed ‘oops!’ flashed on his face before being instantly replaced with an exasperated sigh. “Well, yeah. Because you’re…you!” he seems flustered, motioning to you loosely.

You raise an indignant brow, feeling like he’s somehow secretly insulting you. “What’s that supposed to mean?”

He smirks cynically. “C’ mon, Y/n! Let’s not fool ourselves. That party is not exactly your scene. You’re naive and an innocent sweetheart.”

You can’t help it when your alcohol-infested blood boils at his words which were right but nevertheless presumptuous and arrogant.

“First of all, I already fucking told you to stop calling me that,” you hiss venomously. “Secondly, I’m not fucking innocent,” you practically scream, balling your fists.  

He laughs at you. He fucking laughs at you! 

“Yes, you are.”

He’s making you feel powerless and small and you’re completely in the dark for his reasoning behind this sudden display of assholery. He seemed completely fine just a minute ago, but as soon as you mentioned dancing with James, it’s like a switch just flipped inside of him.

You shove him back by his strong chest, and as he was completely caught off guard by your tiny hands, he stumbles back slightly, his heels catching him before he completely fell on his ass.

“No, I’m not!” You point a threatening finger at him, glaring holes into his head. “I really don’t understand why you’re so fucking upset anyways!”

“Because of you!” He screams so loud, you almost jump out of your skin. 

Shocked into silence, you glance up at him, your eyes wide. 

You take a moment to look closely at this part of Mr. Evans. The infuriated one. That darkness was back in his eyes, but somehow even darker than before. More untamed and wild. Swirling in his eyes is utter hurt and frustration and he looks even more uncontrolled with his hair all disheveled from his constant running his fingers through the dirty blonde locks. His lips pursed tightly, his nostrils flared and his hands balled into tightly-clenched fists, barely holding back his frustrations.

His eyes were alive with a fire that fueled that darkness further and you’d never felt more attracted to something so aggressive and scary-looking. You wanted the warmth of that fire to envelop you in a tight embrace, to ignite your very being alive with its flames. To make you feel something other than despair and frustration and numbness.  

“You’re the fucking reason I’m so messed up, Y/n! Look at me!” He motions to himself desperately, his voice strained. Then he motions around him, throwing his hands up. “Look where I’m fucking at right now! It’s three in the goddam morning and here I am, in the middle of a fucking street arguing with one of my students about something I shouldn’t even be upset by!” He laughs dryly, furious eyes locking on yours. 

“Because why should I give a flying fuck if you’re dancing with another guy?! Why the hell should I give a shit if you’re letting him put his grubby hands on you?…” his voice falters towards the end of his sentence, chest heaving. 

Leaning on a nearby wall, he runs his fingers through his hair. “I shouldn’t even be here right now. If somebody, anybody in that party recognized me, it could literally ruin my life. What the fuck am I even doing here right now?” he breathes to himself.

Even with the sudden urge to grab his face and kiss the living hell out of him burning and sizzling slowly in the pit of your gut, you know what he’s trying to say. He’s done so much for you already. Showing up here like that was a huge risk and you were partially at fault for calling him.

You feel undeniably guilty now.

It’s quiet for a few seconds, with nothing but your heavy breathing filling in the tense, silent atmosphere all around you before you finally speak up, voice shaky and apologetic.

“You know what, Mr. Evans? You’re right. I’m sorry for making you come all the way here.” You smile up at him with a sincere but slightly sad smile as you couldn’t hide that tinge of pain you felt. “And thanks for everything. Really. I know it’s far more than you have to do for any of your students. I’ll see you on Monday.”

And with that, you spin on your heel, decisively walking in the opposite direction of where he’d been taking you.

You only get as far as a few steps from him before Mr. Evans’s big warm hand is wrapping around your uninjured wrist, halting you mid-step and spinning you back around to face him.

You frown confusedly. “Mr-”

“You don’t understand Y/n,” he whispers huskily, chest still heaving with anger, eyes set heavily on you. “I knew this had the potential to ruin me in an instant and I still came.”

You open your mouth to speak, but he immediately cuts you off.

“Don’t you realize?” his laugh isn’t mocking or dry this time. It’s strained and tired and defeated. Your heart squeezes painfully in your chest at the sound of it.

“The problem isn’t that you called me. It’s that I still fucking came! Because you’re driving me absolutely insane sweetheart. I can’t fucking sleep or eat or teach or think or do anything without thinking about you. And it’s killing me to see you walk your pretty little ass around school and my class and not think about that kiss and how much I wanna fucking do it again.” 

His gaze flickers to your slightly parted lips and you can feel your heart positively hammering at his heated confession, ready to rid itself of any inhibitions you may have about any of this in an instant/ 

Slowly, eyes half-hooded and set still on your lips, he begins backing you back against the wall behind you, opposite of him. You stumble backward, entirely spellbound by his dark blue eyes. 

His steps are slow and deliberate, giving you the chance to leave at any point.  He knew you wouldn’t though. He was letting you know that he knew you wouldn’t. Hell, that you couldn’t. Even if you tried. 

Along with that, he was making sure to prolong the aching in your core for as long as possible. To intensify the desperate anticipation with which you awaited his lips. His touch.

You can’t fight him. Both you and he know you don’t want to fight him either.

A barely-audible gasp leaves your lips when your back meets the cold of a stone wall of some random building.

He wraps his arms around your hips first, pressing his forehead to yours, brushing his nose on yours softly, teasing. His eyes flutter as he drags his gaze back up to your own heated gaze.

You could see it in his eyes. He knew this was wrong. He knew the consequences this would eventually bring, but he didn’t care. He yearned for your lips just like you did his. 

Gently, he massages his thumbs into the thin, soft fabric of your dress, leaving you breathless and entirely in awe of his power over you. Then his hands, leaving a blazing trail in their wake, make their way up to your waist, squeezing at the skin softly as if to let you know what was happening was real. That you weren’t dreaming any of things he was doing to you right now. 

That you weren’t making up the requited emotions he felt for you as well. 

Goosebumps rose on your skin and that familiar shudder rippled down your spine in a bold reminder that you were his. His to touch, his to kiss, his to keep. You could never feel the way he made you feel with someone else. Someone else’s touch would never ignite the fire in your belly like his did. Not even close.

“Mr.-”

“You shouldn’t have fucking called me, Y/n,” he hums huskily against your lips.  

You exhale shakily into his mouth, your breaths mingling, your very being trembling in delight. Unable to say anything, you just look at him desperately,

His hands make their torturously delicious way up to your neck where he trails a single finger to your shoulders and nape back and forth gently. You sigh in relief, eyes closing in pure ecstasy.

Finally, his fingers wrap around your cheek and chin, lifting your gaze to properly meet his. 

Your heart is racing in your chest so fast, you’re sure it’s going to fall out any second now. 

His eyes are dark with anger and lust and frustration, but they’re also lighted with something soft and caring. Something you were almost completely convinced resembled love.

You wanted to drown in his touch. His fragrance obscuring all your senses, putting the vodka you’d consumed earlier to shame. It made you feel more intoxicated than the alcohol ever did. Though, instead of numbing you down, it only intensified that painful yearning in your chest and that aggressive throbbing in your core. 

Nothing ever hurt better than being in his arms.

“Fuck,” you strain, pushing against the huge lump in your throat. “We have to stop Mr. Evans.” Your voice is weak, making it clear to him and yourself that you didn’t, in fact, want to ‘stop’.

God, no.

But you had to make an effort to stop this from happening at least. It was wrong. You both knew it and somehow…you didn’t care.

“I know sweetheart. I know. But I don’t think I can hold back anymore. I just want to…” his gaze flickers right back to your lips and he groans under his breath. “Jesus fuck…”

You’re left breathing against his mouth in raggedy breaths, eyes flickering between his lips and his eyes, admiring the sharp and chiseled edges of his face along the way. The dimmed light of the abandoned street illuminated his face enough so you could admire the keen shape of his jaw, the angular slope of his nose and the soft curves and dips of his plump pink lips.

“You don’t get to run around looking this fucking ravishing and expect me to be able to resist you,” he all but growls into you. “You don’t even fucking know what you do to me, do you?”

Then he presses his entire body to yours. Your chests and lower halves now hugged the one to the other, you can feel just how much you’ve affected him and it leaves you spent, that throbbing in your core intensifying by a thousand. Your gut flips in you and a flush of heat spreads through you like wildfire.

As your heated gazes flare-up in unison, both knowing of what was coming next, you know there’s no going back.

“I want you to kiss me, Mr. Evans.”  Your voice is needy and desperate but you can’t find it in you to give a single damn.

And that’s all it takes for the dam to break. In the blink of an eye, Mr. Evans is crashing his lips against yours, hard. 

You suck in a sharp breath as soon as you feel his soft lips make contact with yours. Your chest burned intensely as his wet mouth wrapped around yours harshly, his hands cupping your jaw and roughly tugging you closer to him. 

This kiss is in sharp contrast to your first one, is the first thing you notice. This kiss is rugged and demanding and filled with want much more than the need to comfort eachother.

You were both filled up with a desire and need for eachother that was bottomless. And selfish.

Merely wanting to feel him as close to you as possible, you snake your arms around his neck and draw him closer. 

Your stomach clenches as you feverishly claimed each other’s mouths.

Even with the tempo of the kiss set so high thanks to the wanton yearning finally being released within you, you still moved in sync with each other. His lips and yours worked together like they were always meant to do so, the delightful feeling of his scruff rubbing against your skin sending another wave of pleasant shivers through your body. 

His soft lips controlled yours with so much passion and unfulfilled want that it almost made your legs give out beneath him. His hold on your waist was almost possessive as he pressed you harder against the wall. 

Your mouth acted upon its own free will, tugging his bottom lip in between your teeth and biting it slowly. You wanted to gauge for what reaction this would get you out of him. To experiment with this newfound need to have such control over a man. 

He growls at the teasing nature of your move and attacks your mouth even more aggressively than before. Hot, wet tongue probing its way into your mouth.

He tastes like cinnamon and coffee, making you crave him even more. You press yourself into him, meshing your chest to his.

He works expertly, both your tongues entangling in a dangerous tango. 

His fingers thread into your hair and as if communicating to eachother, you both twist your heads to the side, attempting to get better access at each other’s mouths.

You moved sensually against him, your body moving on its own accord as your hips moved on him in circular motions you had no idea you were even capable of. He grunts a little, his hold on you tightening to a bruising point, almost as if having to physically hold back. 

You found yourself gasping into his mouth at the fairly new feeling of his hardness pressing against you.

Your hands slither their way up to his neck as you played with the messy strands of his hair, tugging and pulling on them gently, running your fingers through their silky smoothness. Moving your other hand down his muscled back, your nails scraped at the skin over the thin cotton fabric of his band tee. You had an ever-growing desperation bubbling inside you that needed an outlet to be released.

Your mind was foggy with want and the pleasure steadily building up in your stomach to worry much about the fact that you were practically dry-humping in the middle of a -vacant- street but nonetheless a street, with your English teacher.

You wanted to drown in his touch. His fragrance obscuring all your senses, putting the vodka you’d consumed earlier to shame. It made you feel more intoxicated than the alcohol ever did. Though, instead of numbing you down, it only intensified that painful yearning in your chest and that aggressive throbbing in your core. 

Nothing ever hurt better than being in his arms.

“Fuck,” you strain, pushing against the huge lump in your throat. “We have to stop Mr. Evans.” Your voice is weak, making it clear to him and yourself that you didn’t, in fact, want to ‘stop’.

God, no.

But you had to make an effort to stop this from happening at least. It was wrong. You both knew it and somehow…you didn’t care.

“I know sweetheart. I know. But I don’t think I can hold back anymore. I just want to…” his gaze flickers right back to your lips and he groans under his breath. “Jesus fuck…”

You’re left breathing against his mouth in raggedy breaths, eyes flickering between his lips and his eyes, admiring the sharp and chiseled edges of his face along the way. The dimmed light of the abandoned street illuminated his face enough so you could admire the keen shape of his jaw, the angular slope of his nose and the soft curves and dips of his plump pink lips.

“You don’t get to run around looking this fucking ravishing and expect me to be able to resist you,” he all but growls into you. “You don’t even fucking know what you do to me, do you?”

Your chests and lower halves now hugged the one to the other, you can feel just how much you’ve affected him and it leaves you spent, that throbbing in your core intensifying by a thousand. Your gut flips in you and a flush of heat spreads through you like wildfire.

As your heated gazes flare-up in unison, both knowing of what was coming next, you know there’s no going back.

“I want you to kiss me, Mr. Evans.”  Your voice is needy and desperate but you can’t find it in you to give a single damn.

You suck in a sharp breath as soon as you feel his soft lips make contact with yours. Your chest burned intensely as his wet mouth wrapped around yours harshly, his hands cupping your jaw and roughly tugging you closer to him.

You were both filled up with a desire and need for eachother that was bottomless. And selfish.

Your stomach clenches as you feverishly claimed each other’s mouths.

Even with the tempo of the kiss set so high thanks to the wanton yearning finally being released within you, you still moved in sync with each other. His lips and yours worked together like they were always meant to do so, the delightful feeling of his scruff rubbing against your skin sending another wave of pleasant shivers through your body. 

His soft lips controlled yours with so much passion and unfulfilled want that it almost made your legs give out beneath him. His hold on your waist was almost possessive as he pressed you harder against the wall. 

Your mouth acted upon its own free will, tugging his bottom lip in between your teeth and biting it slowly. You wanted to gauge for what reaction this would get you out of him. To experiment with this newfound need to have such control over a man.

He tastes like cinnamon and coffee, making you crave him even more. You press yourself into him, meshing your chest to his.

He works expertly, both your tongues entangling in a dangerous tango. 

His fingers thread into your hair and as if communicating to eachother, you both twist your heads to the side, attempting to get better access at each other’s mouths.

You moved sensually against him, your body moving on its own accord as your hips moved on him in circular motions you had no idea you were even capable of. He grunts a little, his hold on you tightening to a bruising point, almost as if having to physically hold back. 

You found yourself gasping into his mouth at the fairly new feeling of his hardness pressing against you.

You had an ever-growing desperation bubbling inside you that needed an outlet to be released.

Your mind was foggy with want and the pleasure steadily building up in your stomach to worry much about the fact that you were practically dry-humping in the middle of a -vacant- street but nonetheless a street, with your English teacher. 

All you could focus on was his hands on you, the way he makes the goddamn most animalistic growl you’ve ever head because of your pulling of his hair. You feel powerful and sexy. Thoroughly ready to be fucked into oblivion by this man.

He takes your bottom lip into his mouth and sucks on it gently, causing an inexplicable pressure to press on your core. You can help but rasp out a moan, taking his jaw into your hands and licking his tongue with a tiny swipe.

He suddenly pauses his kissing you and you find yourself completely out of breath, your veins thrumming with an adrenaline rush you’d missed more than anything in the world. 

He really was like a drug, that man. 

Supporting your weight with the wall, he slowly moves his hands away from your ass, softly caressing your thighs as you dig your heels into his firm ass.

His eyes are shut and lips brushing against yours so you could feel and taste every uneven, raggedy breath leaving his red swollen lips.

Then he moves his head down to your neck, soft lips pressing a light kiss to your flushed skin. 

You tremble, throwing your head back to give him more access and becoming completely undone with the feeling of his soft lips working into your skin in soft, sensual pecks. He begins peppering these all over your skin.

“God, I love your skin. So soft,” he whispers, his hot breath fanning your already-sensitive skin.

You rake your nails through his hair, biting your lip when you hear him groan lightly. 

“And I love your hair. So soft,” you mock him breathlessly, chuckling softly.

He looks up at you, breath faltering when he sees you. “You’re fucking beautiful, have I told you that?”

You smirk, leaning in and pecking his lips. “Once or twice.”

He stares at you a bit longer, lust-filled eyes glimmering beautifully with that softness from before just slightly intensified. You also take this time to admire him in all his after-kiss glory. His even messier hair, his sexy red, swollen lips, his half-hooded hungry eyes. And all of it, all of this, was for you. By you. With you.

He wanted you. And goddamn if you didn’t want him just as bad if not even more.

Mr. Evans smiles goofily, biting his lip in a failed attempt to conceal it.

“We should go,” he mumbles softly after a while of losing yourselves in each others’ gazes. 

Almost like it was inevitable to do so. His eyes were gorgeous and you had a slightly frustrating inability to stop staring into them. Though, you wondered what he’d found in yours other than…bleh. 

You pout, whining. “But why?”

He chuckles, kissing your forehead lightly. “Because you’re drunk and it would be a complete dick move to take advantage of you while you’re like this.”

You smirk, leaning in and softly kissing the shell of his ear. “What if I said I want you to be a dick?” 

You almost can’t believe you’re acting like this, but Mr. Evans had become addictive as a drug.

He sighs deeply, fingers digging into your thighs in a warning.

‘Don’t poke the bear Y/n.’

“I would say there’s literally nothing I’d like more but than to make you mine right here right now, but that I’m not that kind of man. And that I won’t go further than what just happened because that in and of itself was wrong of me to do.” 

You sigh, nodding tightly. “Yeah, you’re right.” 

He copies your gesture, sighing softly before very slowly putting you on your feet.

Your legs were still wobbly and you realized maybe this time the alcohol wasn’t to blame for that.

“You can’t take me home, Mr. Evans,” you say seriously, looking over at him from the passenger seat.

He raises a brow, shifting uncomfortably in his seat like he’d been doing the past few minutes. “And why’s that?”

You chuckle nervously. “Uh, my Dad…kinda doesn’t know I came here…And if he were to find out…well, let’s just say ‘all hell would break loose’ wouldn’t cover it.”

Mr. Evans’s brows rise in shock, basically climbing their way into his hairline.

“What?” You mumble.

Then he breaks out into boisterous laughter. “Oh my God. You- you really never cease to amaze me, you know that? Just when I think I got you all figured out…you go ahead and do shit like this.” He looks at you again, eyes full with a fondness that sent your stomach fluttering and your heart racing.

You grin, shrugging bashfully at him. “I guess.”

He catches your hand, squeezing your fingers. “No, I mean it, sweetheart. You’re fucking incredible.”

His beautiful eyes are full with sincerity and warmth and just like a moth drawn to a flame, you can’t help but feel yourself inexplicably drawn to him.

“You’re amazing too,” you whisper sincerely, cupping his cheek softly.

The moment is broken by his insistent shifting in his seat. You look pointedly at his crotch area, which still displayed his very prominent, uh- excitement, grinning.

“You okay there, Mr. Evans?”

He clears his throat awkwardly, tugging at the jeans barely-concealing his very obvious boner. 

“Stop teasing me. This is your damn fault,” he hisses. 

You laugh. “Tell me again why I  should apologize for merely inspiring such a wonderful reaction in you?”

He rolls his eyes, unable to fight off a small grin. “It’ll go away eventually. Where do I take you then?”

You groan. “A fucking park bench will do.” 

 “What?” 

You blush. “The only other person’s house I can go to is Margo, but she’s off somewhere else taking care of her family emergency.” 

“Don’t you have any other friends you can call up?” 

You sigh, shaking your head embarrassedly. “No. Listen, I’m sorry. I can just go home and-”

“No.” 

You look at him, shocked. “No?”

“No. You can come to my place.” He offers you a small smile.  

You immediately shake your head ‘no’. This offer was ridiculous! With everything that just happened, the level that things had reached, how comfortable you are around him now…it simply wasn’t a wise option to go to his house right now. 

“Absolutely not. I couldn’t ask that of you, Mr. Evans! I can deal with an angry father you-”

“It’s fine, Y/n, really. I want to,” he smiles reassuringly. 

But then again, your angry father wasn’t something you wanted to deal with right now. At all. Just imagining him when he found out what you’d been doing tonight sent unpleasant shivers up your spine. 

You sigh. “But isn’t that too much of a risk? What if-”

“Don’t worry about being seen, sweetheart. I live alone and pretty far from here.”

You chew on your lip nervously, mulling it over even though deep down you already knew your answer. 

“And don’t worry about me trying anything either. I would never do anything like that while you’re drunk or unwilling,” he says sincerely.

You can’t help but raise a teasing brow, smirking. “And if I was sober and willing?”

He chuckles lowly, biting his lip and gazing at you with eyes that said everything you needed to know. 

Feeling a small delightful shiver run through you at the thought, you clear your throat, breaking the sexually-tense staring contest and leaning into his soft leather seats. 

“Let’s go.” 

*

The drive to Mr. Evans’s house is silent for the first few minutes. Calm. And you take that time to relish in the emotion of having him close to you. Feeling the comfort of his warmth so near you. 

Of hearing his heart beat in sync with yours. Of his scent wafting into your nose constantly.

Everything happened so fast… you could barely process the fact that he wanted you too. And not only that, but that you neither of you seemed to care that you were his student and he was your teacher and that all of this, everything that had happened and was happening even now, was so, so inappropriate. 

Because when you were together, none of it mattered. When it was just you and him, everyone who’d judge you didn’t exist. 

You hear him laughing a low, sexy laugh and look over at him with a smile. “What?”

The corner of his lip quirks up into a tiny smirk, his eyes still set on the road. “Nothing, it’s just…remember the last time we were in here together?”

You suck in a sharp breath at the words, memories of your first kiss flooding back and intensifying, even more, when you remember the kissed that just happened. 

The reality of what’d happened- that second kiss. It was unlike any intensity you’d ever felt in your entire life. Even before you even touched lips. You literally felt like if you didn’t kiss him at that exact moment, the very air around you would suffocate you to death. 

And feeling him, all of him, pressed up against you like that sent you spiraling into your deepest, darkest fantasies. You wanted him to fuck you on every surface of this car and the throbbing between your legs - the one you’d now had the mere semblance of- came back to you full force, pulsating so hard it forced you to press your thighs together. 

“You okay?” Mr. Evans’s voice snaps you back to reality and you jump a little. 

“Huh? Oh, uh…yeah. Yeah! I’m fine.” You clear your throat, trying to calm your racing heart and mind. “So…how’d you find me either way?”

“Lucky guess.” He shrugs. “Heard some students talking about the huge party at Jenna Millers’ tonight and figured it wasn’t a coincidence you were drunk and calling me while in this state on the same day it was happening.”

You laugh nervously, cheeks heating up as you recall what you said to him on the phone. “Yeah, sorry ‘bout what I said on the phone.” 

He grins smugly. “Sorry? Why are you sorry? I for one think it’s the best phone call I’ve probably ever gotten!”   

 You roll your eyes, crossing your arms over your chest. “Yeah, yeah. Laugh it up… How much longer ‘til we get there?” 

He smiles. “We’re still a few minutes away, sweetheart.” 

You hum in acknowledgment. “Can I put on some music?” 

He raises his brows, but smiles and nods nonetheless, motioning to his radio. “Help yourself.” 

You lean over, feeling strangely giddy as you flip through stations. 

You gasp excitedly when you hear the initial notes of your favorite song. 

“I love this song!” You turn the volume up and grin over at Mr. Evans who’s seems bewildered as hell by your seemingly random enthusiasm. 

I hopped off the plane at LAX
With a dream and my cardigan
Welcome to the land of fame excess,
Whoa, am I gonna fit in?

His expression turns to one of realization and then to bemusement as he watches you lower the window. You let the wind pass through your hair with a big smile on your face, enjoying the chilly night on your flushed skin. 

My tummy’s turnin’ and I’m feelin’ kinda home sick
Too much pressure and I’m nervous,
That’s when the taxi man turned on the radio
And the Jay Z song was on
And the Jay Z song was on
And the Jay Z song was on

You belt out the lyrics with sheer joy coming out of your every pore.  

So I put my hands up
They’re playing my song,
And the butterflies fly away
Noddin’ my head like, yeah
Movin’ my hips like, yeah
I got my hands up,
They’re playin’ my song
You know I’m gonna be okay
Yeah, it’s a party in the USA
Yeah it’s a party in the USA

When the chorus hits, you have no problem sticking your hand out the window to feel the air rushing in between your fingertips, a  Cheshire cat spread wide on your lips. 

Mr. Evans laughs loudly at you and you look at him over your shoulder, grinning as you waggle your brows. He laughs louder, turning his eyes back to the road as you continue singing your heart out to “Party in the U.S.A.” by Miley Cyrus like your very life depended on it. 

The car slows to a stop just as the song is ending and you lower the volume of the radio and the window, still grinning from ear to ear. 

The house is before you is relatively big. It and the porch painted a thematic white and grey. 

Your smile widens impossible more and you turn to Mr. Evans to comment on his house. “Mr. Evans this house is-mmph!” 

You don’t get to say anything before his lips are on yours though, his fingers threading into your wind-rustled hair. You immediately respond, cupping his cheeks as he presses a soft and loving kiss to your lips. 

When he breaks away, your smile is smaller but softer and loving.

“What was that for?” You whisper breathlessly. 

He shrugs, mirroring your smile. “For being so goddamn cute.” 

And then he’s climbing out of the car, leaving you flushed and bashful and an utter puddle of soft emotions. 

You groan into your hands, sinking into the car seat. 

How the hell were you supposed to survive even a few hours without jumping this man’s bones?

(Gif isn’t mine!)

You would’ve thought the fact that Mr. Evans was the one who went in, knight armor glimmering heroically under the party lights, and saved you from the gross human being that was James McDaniels would’ve shocked the drunkness right out of you, but all it did was make your head spin even more rapidly.

“What the hell are you doing here?” You can’t help but slur in a mumble.

Mr. Evans digs his fingers tightly into the soft skin of your thighs, lips parting with a large exhale.

“I could ask you the same question sweetheart,” he practically growls, turning a sharp corner and concealing both of you from the probing eyes at the party.

You giggle a little, nuzzling his neck and breathing in his intoxicating scent. “I wanted to have some fun.”

You feel his chest rise and shakily fall as he releases a trembling breath then laughs. “You’re just full of them aren’t you?”

You look up at him, frowning. “Them?”

He bites his lip to hold back a big goofy smile but fails miserably. “Surprises. You’re full of surprises, sweetheart.”

You press your lips to the nape of his neck lightly and mumble gently into the soft skin. “Am I?”

He swallows hard and you feel his big warm hands lightly shaking on your skin.

“Oh, you’re nothing but trouble Ms. Y/l/n,” he practically rasps, his voice strained and husky.

Uncaring if you’re crossing any lines even by simply being in his presence right now, you laugh softly, pressing closer to his warm chest and letting out a content sigh.

You break away from him, looking up at his face. “Thank you,” you manage to say sincerely through your drunken gaze. “For saving me, I mean.”

He clears his throat. “I wasn’t going to let him touch you like that.”

You shudder in his arms at the thought of whatever it was that James was planning to do with you. “He misunderstood my intentions with him. I only danced with him because it seemed like fun a fun thing to do at the time. But that’s all it was. Dancing. And I let him touch me a bit because I thought it was innocent. But then he didn’t want to stop when I told him to.”

At this, all signs of lust and humor are gone from his face and he halts his brisk walk in the middle of a lonely street.

You furrow your brows confusedly at him as he sets you down on the ground gently. You hold onto his neck for support as your legs wobble slightly before entirely untangling yourself from him.

The street is completely pitch black aside from a single streetlight which only illuminates half of both of you.

“You can walk on your own from here on out. My car’s only a few blocks away,” he mumbles coldly over his shoulder at you, stalking ahead.

You raise a brow at his sudden shift in attitude. “Okay…” you mumble to yourself, clumsily stumbling on behind him.

It only takes a few minutes of you consistently cursing your drunkness and heels for your inability to walk properly before Mr. Evans stops walking abruptly, causing you to crash head-first against his strong back. You grunt when your nose gets crushed on his firm muscles.

“Ow!” You stumble back, rubbing the sore spot frantically in an attempt to massage the ache away.

When you look back up at him, though, you’re shocked to find that he’s taken his sunglasses off, bright blue eyes now glaring holes into you.

“What the hell were you even thinking Y/n? Huh!?” He hisses.

You blink at him slowly, whiplashing at his sudden change in demeanor. “Wha-what do you mean?”

He laughs dryly, jabbing an angry finger directly at you. “Oh my- I mean that I literally just had to pry off and beat the living hell out of one of my goddam students for you!”

You raise an indignant brow at his accusatory tone. Like this was somehow your fucking fault.

“And that’s my fault, how exactly?”

He scoffs. “Well, You came alone to a fucking party, for starters. I mean,” he licks his lips, laughing humorlessly. “What girl your age fucking does that!?”

“I didn’t! Margo had to leave early for a family emergency,” you quickly defend before quietly adding; “and you didn’t have to beat James up like that.”

He runs his long fingers through his hair making his hoodie fall off and licks his lips in pure frustration again.

“I didn’t have- I didn’t have to beat James up like that!” He laughs darkly mocking your statement before looking down at you incredulously.

“He was putting his damn hands on you sweetheart! He was going to drag you off to god-knows-where to-“ he instantly cuts himself off, sucking in a sharp breath. His eyes screw shut and his jaw clenches tightly, ticking.

“Shit, just thinking about it makes me wanna go back in there to finish what I started,” he growls so low under his breath that if it wasn’t for the isolation of the place you were in, you wouldn’t have been able to hear him.

His eyes turn to you once more, the heat of his anger warming your skin as he slowly moves in, stalking up to you with avid, determined steps.  

“So yes, I did have to beat him up like that. Because he’s a goddam scum bag who shouldn’t be forcing himself on girls. Especially you!”

He’s completely red in the face, the veins of his neck prominently protruding from his neck as well as from his forehead.

“Me?” you pause, frowning in confusion at him.

He freezes as well and for a second, an expression that screamed ‘oops!’ flashed on his face before being instantly replaced with an exasperated sigh. “Well, yeah. Because you’re…you!” he seems flustered, motioning to you loosely.

You raise an indignant brow, feeling like he’s somehow secretly insulting you. “What’s that supposed to mean?”

He smirks cynically. “C’ mon, Y/n! Let’s not fool ourselves. That party is not exactly your scene. You’re naive and an innocent sweetheart.”

You can’t help it when your alcohol-infested blood boils at his words which were right but nevertheless presumptuous and arrogant.

“First of all, I already fucking told you to stop calling me that,” you hiss venomously. “Secondly, I’m not fucking innocent,” you practically scream, balling your fists.  

He laughs at you. He fucking laughs at you! 

“Yes, you are.”

He’s making you feel powerless and small and you’re completely in the dark for his reasoning behind this sudden display of assholery. He seemed completely fine just a minute ago, but as soon as you mentioned dancing with James, it’s like a switch just flipped inside of him.

You shove him back by his strong chest, and as he was completely caught off guard by your tiny hands, he stumbles back slightly, his heels catching him before he completely fell on his ass.

“No, I’m not!” You point a threatening finger at him, glaring holes into his head. “I really don’t understand why you’re so fucking upset anyways!”

“Because of you!” He screams so loud, you almost jump out of your skin. 

Shocked into silence, you glance up at him, your eyes wide. 

You take a moment to look closely at this part of Mr. Evans. The infuriated one. That darkness was back in his eyes, but somehow even darker than before. More untamed and wild. Swirling in his eyes is utter hurt and frustration and he looks even more uncontrolled with his hair all disheveled from his constant running his fingers through the dirty blonde locks. His lips pursed tightly, his nostrils flared and his hands balled into tightly-clenched fists, barely holding back his frustrations.

His eyes were alive with a fire that fueled that darkness further and you’d never felt more attracted to something so aggressive and scary-looking. You wanted the warmth of that fire to envelop you in a tight embrace, to ignite your very being alive with its flames. To make you feel something other than despair and frustration and numbness.  

“You’re the fucking reason I’m so messed up, Y/n! Look at me!” He motions to himself desperately, his voice strained. Then he motions around him, throwing his hands up. “Look where I’m fucking at right now! It’s three in the goddam morning and here I am, in the middle of a fucking street arguing with one of my students about something I shouldn’t even be upset by!” He laughs dryly, furious eyes locking on yours. 

“Because why should I give a flying fuck if you’re dancing with another guy?! Why the hell should I give a shit if you’re letting him put his grubby hands on you?…” his voice falters towards the end of his sentence, chest heaving. 

Leaning on a nearby wall, he runs his fingers through his hair. “I shouldn’t even be here right now. If somebody, anybody in that party recognized me, it could literally ruin my life. What the fuck am I even doing here right now?” he breathes to himself.

Even with the sudden urge to grab his face and kiss the living hell out of him burning and sizzling slowly in the pit of your gut, you know what he’s trying to say. He’s done so much for you already. Showing up here like that was a huge risk and you were partially at fault for calling him.

You feel undeniably guilty now.

It’s quiet for a few seconds, with nothing but your heavy breathing filling in the tense, silent atmosphere all around you before you finally speak up, voice shaky and apologetic.

“You know what, Mr. Evans? You’re right. I’m sorry for making you come all the way here.” You smile up at him with a sincere but slightly sad smile as you couldn’t hide that tinge of pain you felt. “And thanks for everything. Really. I know it’s far more than you have to do for any of your students. I’ll see you on Monday.”

And with that, you spin on your heel, decisively walking in the opposite direction of where he’d been taking you.

You only get as far as a few steps from him before Mr. Evans’s big warm hand is wrapping around your uninjured wrist, halting you mid-step and spinning you back around to face him.

You frown confusedly. “Mr-”

“You don’t understand Y/n,” he whispers huskily, chest still heaving with anger, eyes set heavily on you. “I knew this had the potential to ruin me in an instant and I still came.”

You open your mouth to speak, but he immediately cuts you off.

“Don’t you realize?” his laugh isn’t mocking or dry this time. It’s strained and tired and defeated. Your heart squeezes painfully in your chest at the sound of it.

“The problem isn’t that you called me. It’s that I still fucking came! Because you’re driving me absolutely insane sweetheart. I can’t fucking sleep or eat or teach or think or do anything without thinking about you. And it’s killing me to see you walk your pretty little ass around school and my class and not think about that kiss and how much I wanna fucking do it again.” 

His gaze flickers to your slightly parted lips and you can feel your heart positively hammering at his heated confession, ready to rid itself of any inhibitions you may have about any of this in an instant/
